story:
Bluebird: uncaged is planning on producing two live performances. One during our third uncaged adventure to Panama Central America and another here in Atlanta as we continue the tradition of Uncaged Christmas. 

We’ve been blessed with these unique opportunities and can’t wait to tackle them. Unfortunately, these opportunities cost money. The estimated cost for venue rental and crew compensation for our remaining productions is approximately $6000.

We believe that Bluebird: uncaged exists to bring light into the darkness and we want to partner with you to help make that happen. This is an all skate for the Bluebird: uncaged community—We realize that not everyone is gifted to be a dancer or choreographer but all of us have been given financial resources and some sort of social media platform. In partnering with us through this indiegogo campaign, you’ll help defray the hard costs for our live productions both in Panama and Uncaged Christmas in Atlanta.

story:
Chicago. Present Day. Xtigone's brothers, leaders of rival gangs, are meeting to discuss a gun truce. Things go awry, bullets fly, and the people seek answers when two more bodies lie on their city block. Tigs asks her Uncle, Marcellus da Man (The Mayor), to help her unearth the truth. Will Marcellus help Tigs or further cover up the problem? Through lyricism, movement, and music this re-imagining of Sophocles' Antigone tells the story of the ill-fated Xtigone and her quest for her community's truth.

Chicago Danztheatre Ensemble is thrilled to present the midwest premiere of Nambi E. Kelley's Xtigone.

We need your support to make this happen.  By raising $4000 online to meet our goal of $5000.  This amount raised will not only go toward covering production costs but we will be giving away 500 tickets to youth and community members affected by gun and gang violence.  Be an activist by making a financial contribution.

story:
"Artists are the gatekeepers of truth. 

Without us, the world does not know itself." 

Harry Belafonte

Why donate?
Your donation will help us bring our first show to the stage, Martin McDonagh's dark comedy, The Beauty Queen of Leenane. This hauntingly beautiful script tells the story of 40-year-old Maureen, her last chance for love, and her manipulative mother's derailment attempts. We've rented a lovely space, in the heart of the Rogers Park arts district. Our show will run July 23-August 9, performing Thursday-Saturday evenings and Sunday matinees.

Who are we?

Three Crows is a Chicago-based, ensemble theatre company committed to telling honest, thought-provoking, entertaining stories. Our story telling is dedicated to performing pieces that give voices to women, minorities, and those who don't have anything but have more than nothing.

We want to have an established theatre home in the vibrant arts community on the Northside of Chicago. Many of our friends are very talented and dedicated actors, directors, playwrights, stage managers, and designers but they have no artistic home in which to grow or work on pieces they feel passionately about. We hope to create an environment that cultivates artists working together on projects that resonate and stir their souls. 

Our Future

We hope to perform three ensemble based, character driven plays a year, possibly increasing that number in a few years. We also want to present new works by emerging playwrights. Eventually we hope to have our own space. We hope to give back to the community, either through volunteerism or charitable projects, for every single show.

story:
**Can't See the above Video? Click Here To Watch**


Our Mission

Unlike your typical comedy club, Zingerz is a Membership Discount Club for Comedy (think of us as Sam's Club for Funny).  Although Zingerz Comedy's Improv Show is new it is supported by an experienced team, both on stage and off, with backgrounds in Theater/Comedy Club Ownership/Management, Improv Comedy Production, and overall Corporate Management (CEO, CFO, COO, etc.). 

The central DFW area is currently short on Clean Entertainment options.  Families and lovers of clean comedy are limited in their outing choices, and LIVE entertainment options for those seeking family friendly fun are even more scarce.  Most live comedy within the Dallas/Fort Worth area is blue... Not "blue" like the Smurfs, but bad language & inappropriate material "blue"... Got it?  Okay.  Families are not welcome to these shows and the Central DFW area has NO Improv Comedy options at all!  Zingerz Comedy Club wants to change this by setting up a permanent home for CLEAN IMPROV COMEDY right here in central DFW!!!


What Is Improv Comedy?

Improv Comedy is an interactive entertainment experience unlike any other. Simply put, Improv Comedy is comedy that is improvised. No Scripts. No Prep. Just the Players making funny stuff up off the top of their heads ON THE SPOT from suggestions made by the audience. Every Zingerz Comedy Club Improv Show will be Very Interactive with TONS of audience participation! Not only will the audience get to yell out suggestions for each game but also send game suggestions via social media! Some audience members will even be able to get up on stage and become part of the show! Every Skit is Unique and No Show Will Ever Be The Same!

*Although void of bad language and inappropriate subject matter (sex, drugs, violence, etc.) Our Full-Length Improv Comedy Shows are most appropriate for older kids (10+) as many of the jokes will not be as understandable to younger children.  Shorter Shows designed for younger children will also be available.*

Coming to the show to celebrate a special day? Let us know and we will make sure to get you (or the victim of your choice) on stage for some FUN YOU WILL NEVER FORGET!!! Love to Tweet? We encourage our audience members to Tweet about their memorable moments during the show!!!

With Improv, you don't just watch comedy... you LIVE IT!



Zingerz Needz & Perkz

Zingerz Comedy Club's Goal is to raise $4,400 in order to help establish a permanent home for our Clean Improv Comedy Show.  This money will go towards: rent, talent, staff, marketing, equipment, a toilet seat cover, season tickets to Six Flags, a rare Troll Doll, and... wait, not the last two, or maybe three... Sorry.  Just rent, talent, staff, marketing, and equipment... And two little bells that go "ding".  Okay, yeah that's all.    

A permanent venue has already been secured at an upcoming new business in Bedford, TX - the Upright Cafe!  The Upright Cafe is not your standard cafe as it shares Zingerz Comedy's vision of family-friendly entertainment for all!  On top of great food, they have life-size puppet shows, a game show with prizes, karaoke, a recording studio, and two stages for live performances!  In addition to our new permanent home, Zingerz Comedy Club will also perform our Clean Improv Comedy Show throughout the Central DFW area (Arlington, Mansfield, Grand Prairie, etc.)!

In return for your support we are offering some really FUN PERKZ!

Comedy With A Cause

Zingerz Comedy Club will not only provide Central DFW with the best in Clean Improv Comedy but will also help the community as a whole by making every show available for FUNdraiZING opportunities to local non-profit organizations!

Wholesome Live Entertainment is an important cause and one we believe in very much!  With YOUR SUPPORT We Can Make This Happen!  Your Pledges will provide people with a clean entertainment option currently not readily available - even many PG movies now have questionable content.  If you want Wholesome Fun that is also Very Funny, then this is the Indiegogo Campaign for you! 

Please Spread The Word about this Campaign to All Your Family, Friends, Acquaintances, Neighbors, Colleagues, Peers, Enemies, Strangers, Pets... Well, you get the picture ;)  Help Create Buzz and get people talking about this Campaign! Your Support is NEEDED and APPRECIATED!  Help Bring Live Family Friendly Interactive Comedy to Central DFW and Become Part of the Show! 

Keep up with us at www.ZingerzComedyClub.com or on facebook at www.facebook.com/ZingerzComedyClub!  THANK YOU & LAUGH ON!!!


Risks & Challenges

Many of the risks and challenges faced by Zingerz Comedy Club will be greatly diminished by your support in this campaign.  We have a pool of talented individuals, both on stage and off, further helping to reduce the risks that any business venture would face.  These individuals have extensive backgrounds in not only the entertainment industry (Comedy Club Ownership/Management, Improv, Theater Management, etc.) but within overall business ownership/management (company CEOs, CFO/CPAs, a Small Business Author, etc.)  We KNOW that with your SUPPORT Zingerz Comedy Club's CLEAN IMPROV COMEDY SHOW will be delighting and entertaining the residents of central DFW for years!
story_txt:
**Can't See the above Video? Click Here To Watch**

Our Mission


Unlike your typical comedy club, Zingerz is a Membership Discount Club for Comedy (think of us as Sam's Club for Funny).  Although Zingerz Comedy's Improv Show is new it is supported by an experienced team, both on stage and off, with backgrounds in Theater/Comedy Club Ownership/Management, Improv Comedy Production, and overall Corporate Management (CEO, CFO, COO, etc.).  The central DFW area is currently short on Clean Entertainment options. 
 Families and lovers of clean comedy are limited in their outing 
choices, and LIVE entertainment options for those seeking family friendly fun are 
even more scarce.  Most live comedy within the Dallas/Fort Worth area is blue... Not "blue" like the Smurfs, but bad language & inappropriate material "blue"... Got it?  Okay.  Families are not welcome to these shows and the Central DFW area has NO Improv 
Comedy options at all!  Zingerz Comedy Club wants to change this by setting up a
 permanent home for CLEAN IMPROV COMEDY right here in central DFW!!!
What Is Improv Comedy?

 Improv Comedy is an interactive 
entertainment experience unlike any other.  Simply put, Improv Comedy is
 comedy that is improvised.  No Scripts.  No Prep.  Just the Players 
making funny stuff up off the top of their heads ON THE SPOT from 
suggestions made by the audience.  Every Zingerz Comedy Club Improv Show
 will be Very Interactive with TONS of audience participation!  Not only
 will the audience get to yell out suggestions for each game but also 
send game suggestions via social media!  Some audience members will even
 be able to get up on stage and become part of the show!  Every Skit is 
Unique and No Show Will Ever Be The Same!
*Although void of bad
 language and inappropriate subject matter (sex, drugs, violence, etc.) 
Our Full-Length Improv Comedy Shows are most appropriate for older kids (10+) as many of the 
jokes will not be as understandable to younger children.  Shorter Shows designed for younger children will also be available.*
Coming
 to the show to celebrate a special day?  Let us know and we will make 
sure to get you (or the victim of your choice) on stage for some FUN YOU
 WILL NEVER FORGET!!!  Love to Tweet?  We encourage our audience members
 to Tweet about their memorable moments during the show!!!
With Improv, you don't just watch comedy... you LIVE IT!

  Zingerz Needz & Perkz
 Zingerz Comedy Club's Goal is to raise $4,400 in order to help establish a 
permanent home for our Clean Improv Comedy Show.  This money will go 
towards: rent, talent, staff, marketing, equipment, a toilet seat cover,
 season tickets to Six Flags, a rare Troll Doll, and... wait, not the 
last two, or maybe three... Sorry.  Just rent, talent, staff, marketing,
 and equipment... And two little bells that go "ding".  Okay, yeah that's all.      
A permanent venue has already been secured at an upcoming new business in Bedford, TX - the Upright Cafe!  The Upright Cafe is not your standard cafe as it shares Zingerz Comedy's vision of family-friendly entertainment for all!  On top of great food, they have life-size puppet shows, a game show with prizes, karaoke, a recording studio, and two stages for live performances!  In addition to our new permanent home, Zingerz Comedy Club will also perform our Clean Improv Comedy Show throughout the Central DFW area (Arlington, Mansfield, Grand Prairie, etc.)!
In return for your support we are offering some really FUN PERKZ!



  Comedy With A Cause
 
Zingerz Comedy Club will not only provide Central DFW with 
the best in Clean Improv Comedy but will also help the community as a 
whole by making every show available for FUNdraiZING opportunities to 
local non-profit organizations!
 
Wholesome Live Entertainment is an important cause and one we believe in very much!  With YOUR SUPPORT We Can Make This Happen!  Your Pledges will provide people with a clean entertainment option currently not readily available - even many PG movies now have questionable content.  If you want Wholesome Fun that is also Very Funny, then this is the Indiegogo Campaign for you!

about this Campaign to All Your Family, Friends, Acquaintances, 
Neighbors, Colleagues, Peers, Enemies, Strangers, Pets... Well, you get the picture ;)  Help Create Buzz and get people talking about this Campaign! Your Support is NEEDED and APPRECIATED!  Help Bring Live Family Friendly Interactive Comedy to Central DFW and Become Part of the Show!

story:
Parcours: A Life Journey

Parcours is the performance of a lifetime. It follows a spirit in human form as she discovers the world around her, rejects limitations and learns how to fly by finding her purpose. 

  • The story is about me, it's about you. It is about all of us as the human race begins to wake up to our full potential. I am a musical theatre artist, I was tired of reading all the inspirational quotes about "being enough" while simultaneously trying to break into an industry that always pointed out what I lack. I developed Parcours out of my need to create, my passion for my art and my devotion to mankind. 
  • This Campaign for a Juneteenth Premiere serves many purposes. It will allow me to mount this project, one that has been over 4 years in the making, and has taken me all the way to Paris, France to develop, and it will be a fundraiser for Black Ops, a new Black Theatre Company in my hometown Durham, NC.
  • As a contributor you will not only be helping me fulfill my life purpose, you will be assisting many other artists of color in the Durham community with the creation of Black Ops Theatre Troupe. A Juneteenth Premiere of a completely new type of theatrical work will remind the community that just as there are living artists to support, there are living, revolutionary people of color to celebrate. Parcours is a breathtaking demonstration of both.

Are you ready to join the rEvolution?

Become a Parcours Sojourner Today. 

As for the Energy Units:

  • The funding that is raised in this campaign will go to space rental, rigging of an aerial lyra, set pieces, costuming, a lighting designer, and stage manager. 
  • As a contributor, you may receive personalized artwork in the style of Parcours, you can be guaranteed a cameo in the interactive portion of the project, you can even book me for lunch and a Lyra lesson for you or a friend!
  • So far I have been funding my project piece by piece (training, small props, in home Lyra) myself. At this point in the manifestation of the work I need your help. Big purchases are coming up and every penny counts to birth the most important creation I have ever attempted.

  • Calling rEvoltionaries

Look, you don't need some conspiracy theorist telling you the world we live in is dying because of our way of living. You are connected to the soul of the Earth and deep down you already know it.

There is a way to ensure your happiness, your childrens happiness, their well being and the future of humanity...

  • In those times you made those hard decisions, stepped on that crab to get out of the barrel, turned a blind eye to a wrong doing, to help your family, so that they would not suffer, so that they "could have"...  
  • You made those decisions in the hope that your children would never have to, but more increasingly with every generation we make one more hard decision for our family, not one less.
  • In this ever conscious era Parcours will serve the purpose of demonstrating how a healthy, happy, benevolent world is within our grasp. Parcours is necessary because it will serve as a spark in the minds of people who can and will make a positive difference in our world. 

  • Never Give Up
  • My entire existence as a performer has been an uphill battle, and I am not alone. Performers, rEvolutionaries, everyone struggling to find their path and honor their passion, fight everyday to realize a dream. Parcours is my Crusade, my gift of myself to the world, and nothing will stop me from fulfilling that calling.
  • With your help, I can fully realize this dream, better yet, we can realize it together.

  • Side Paths
  •  If monetary energy units aren't something you have right now I get it. We are all trying to make a dollar out of .15. If you can please give, remembering that what you give truly does come back to you ten fold. but if you can't then share with your friends, your directors, you colleagues, your family. Anyone who loves art or loves you, or loves me, or loves the world, or the sun, or the moon! Share this post and my website. Help me get the word out, I am so excited to create and give myself to you and I want us to all journey together!
  • Don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools!

See you at the Show!

It will allow me to mount this project, one that has been over 4 years in the making, and has taken me all the way to Paris, France to develop, and it will be a fundraiser for Black Ops, a new Black Theatre Company in my hometown Durham, NC.

So far I have been funding my project piece by piece (training, small props, in home Lyra) myself. At this point in the manifestation of the work I need your help. Big purchases are coming up and every penny counts to birth the most important creation I have ever attempted.


Calling rEvoltionaries
 Look, you don't need some conspiracy theorist telling you the world we live in is dying because of our way of living. You are connected to the soul of the Earth and deep down you already know it.
There is a way to ensure your happiness, your childrens happiness, their well being and the future of humanity...  In those times you made those hard decisions, stepped on that crab to get out of the barrel, turned a blind eye to a wrong doing, to help your family, so that they would not suffer, so that they "could have"...   You made those decisions in the hope that your children would never have to, but more increasingly with every generation we make one more hard decision for our family, not one less.

Never Give Up

Performers, rEvolutionaries, everyone struggling to find their path and honor their passion, fight everyday to realize a dream. Parcours is my Crusade, my gift of myself to the world, and nothing will stop me from fulfilling that calling.
With your help, I can fully realize this dream, better yet, we can realize it together.


Side Paths


 If monetary energy units aren't something you have right now I get it. We are all trying to make a dollar out of .15. If you can please give, remembering that what you give truly does come back to you ten fold. but if you can't then share with your friends, your directors, you colleagues, your family. Anyone who loves art or loves you, or loves me, or loves the world, or the sun, or the moon! Share this post and my website. Help me get the word out, I am so excited to create and give myself to you and I want us to all journey together! Don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools!   See you at the Show!

story:
Breve reseña

Mi nombre es Grace Becker, mi pasión es el baile y la expresión corporal, he tenido algunas oportunidades de salir del país; ahora, quiero dar la oportunidad a alguien más para que crezca tanto como yo. 

Fui parte de Stroke Urbano, grupo de bailarines profesionales.  Mi deseo es ayudarlos a que exploren más allá y puedan crecer en el arte de la danza. 

Viajar para bailar me hizo crecer como bailarina y como persona, así que quiero que otros vivan esta experiencia también.  Por esta razón, empezare por becar uno de ellos y que viajen a Chicago a recibir un taller intensivo de danza sería una gran oportunidad para que sigan explotando su talento.  En este caso escogí a Mirna Moreno integrante del grupo y especializada en Jazz y hip hop para hacer el primer viaje y la primera donación. 

El mundo es tan grande que no podemos solo estar en un solo lugar, esto desencadenará un intercambio de culturas y de danza; parte de mi sueño, es romper con las barreras culturales y crear un sentido de comunidad entre individuos. 

Para Mirna a quien le daría la beca esto es seria como un sueño hecho realidad.  Darle un viaje todo pagado para ir a hacer lo que ama es algo va a cambiarle la vida. 


Más a detalle

·  Lo que quiero es que Mirna Moreno vaya al Workshop intensivo de Giordano Dance Jazz a Chicago este Junio 2015. 

·  El financiamiento que estoy pidiendo va directo a el pago del taller intensivo que son $850.00, el ticket de avión cuesta $800.00 aproximadamente, la estadía (que pediré hospedaje a mis amigos para bajar costos); también evalué unos $300.00  y viáticos, porque no quisiera que ella pasara inconvenientes durante su viaje. 

·  Este financiamiento es administrado por mí, con  los contactos que tengo facilitaré los pagos anticipados y le daré lo que necesite.

·  Dar es mejor que recibir, al iniciar esto quiero experimentar lo que es realmente dar algo de gran a valor a alguien que de otra manera se le dificultaría demasiado conseguirlo. 

·  Si no se alcanza la meta, aun así este dinero va ayudará a mi amiga y al grupo de baile Stroke Urbano. Ellos siempre necesitan financiamiento de vestuario y atenciones médicas (por cualquier lesión que ellos pudieran tener), que como bailarines siempre estamos al borde de cualquier golpe.  Es necesario que estén atendidos. 

El impacto: Cambiando al mundo un movimiento a la vez. 

·  Esta campaña es un comienzo para empezar una fundación de becas para bailarines guatemaltecos.  Todos debemos tener el apoyo de convertirnos en las personas que nacimos para hacer. Becas son el mejor comienzo para esto. 

·  He trabajado con la Organización para las Artes (ORPA) y esta es una fundación sin fines de lucro que se dedica a traer arte a Guatemala. Estoy tomando el ejemplo que me da Geraldina Baca-Spross al haber becado a una joven de muy escasos recursos a participar en un concurso con el Houston Ballet y al final esta misma joven fue ganadora de una beca para viajar. Así que he visto el impacto que puede tener esta pequeña contribución económica. 

·  Pequeñas acciones hacen grandes cambios y quiero generar más pequeñas acciones, porque todos nacimos para hacer grandes cosas. :)

Riesgos y desafíos

Entiendo que hay muchísimos obstáculos para lograr ener un fondo de becas y mantener un flujo de caja; y, que los becados aprovechen al máximo este recurso.  Soy alguien determinada y sumamente apasionada, en especial por la danza, así que ante todo, quiero ver a mis amigos bailarines superarse y llegar a niveles profesionales que ni ellos se imaginan. Guatemala tiene talento y quiero compartirlo. 

Si cualquier inconveniente sucediera, pues emprenderé más trabajos alternos y presentaciones para conseguir el dinero y seguir ayudando a los bailarines. 

·  Para mantener el flujo en el fondo, conectaré empresas alternas para contribuir. 

·  Para asegurarme que los jóvenes becados aprovecharan este recurso, pues primero serán audicionados (la que quiero becar ahora ya lo está y me consta que hará el mejor uso de esto) 

·  De tener más desafíos siempre podemos bailar para recaudar más fondos y eso también me da seguridad de que los bailarines están determinados a bailar y compartir lo que han aprendido. 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Otras maneras en las que me puedes ayudar son: 

Puedes compartir mi campaña en tus redes sociales y contarles a tus amigos de mi iniciativa. 

También si quisieras ayudar de otra manera, ya sea conoces gente en Chicago o alguien que pudiera contribuir con hospedaje o el ticket del avión, acepto también gente motivada que quiera colaborar conmigo a este fondo para bailarines. 

Aquí en Indiegogo hay muchas herramientas que pueden ayudar a difundir mi campaña. 

De verdad gracias por darme de tu tiempo para leer esto y ¡muchas más gracias por tu apoyo! :)

story:
Why Zambra? Why Now?

Forbidden for centuries, Zambra is a Spanish dance and music tradition of Moorish, Sephardi and Gypsy origins that has survived against all odds for more than 500 years to become a cultural phenomenon during the first half of the 20th century. Unfortunately, Zambra  (also known as Zambra Mora) is now an art in danger of extinction.

I am Puela Lunaris, founder of Dances of the World Society. Since 1994, I have been devoted to researching and rescuing different styles of Zambras, especially the Flamenco forms I loved from childhood.

I was born and raised in Montánchez, an ancient village in Southwestern Spain with an impressive Morisco castle, which used to be part of al-Andalus. The women in the village sang Zambras regularly. I have fond memories of dancing to Zambras as a child.

However, this is not just a personal quest. Zambra is an essential patrimony we need to protect because Zambra is a tradition of great significance for many dancers and musicians around the world.

With your support, I will create The Zambra Center so you can benefit from my extensive research.

The Impact

The Zambra Online Resource Center is one of my initiatives as founder of Dances of the World Society. Through DWS, I’ve partnered with organizations and individuals who are also interested in preserving dance and music traditions in danger of extinction. With their support, I am working to save the wisdom inherent in these traditions, such an important legacy to preserve for future generations.

I’ve completed ethnographic field research in Morocco, Iraq Jordan, and Spain. Always fascinated by world dance ethnic traditions, I have also learned a great deal by dancing in the kitchens of families from Egypt, Turkey, Greece, Armenia, Lebanon and India.  

The Zambra Center is part of The Chanelar Flamenco Project, which is Dances of the World Society’s program focusing on rescuing aspects of Flamenco in danger of extinction.

To this day, Zambra remains a major Flamenco and Copla form and it is also a vital Flamenco tradition as represented in the Zambras Gitanas del Sacromonte.

Furthermore, the Zambra Mora tradition has influenced outstanding classical composers and world-class guitar players like Maestro Sabicas, which in turn have had an impact on modern day composers, such as Rob Mastrianni of the celebrated Beatbox Guitar. Latin Grammy award winners, Ojos de Brujo, have also chosen to honor Zambra.  

Moreover, Zambra Mora has become very popular among bellydancers worldwide. It was because of the requests of my Bellydance students, I produced my first Zambra educational video in 2002.

It’s now time to take it to the next level. I receive emails from dancers around the world asking questions like: Why was Zambra Mora forbidden? Who forbade them?  What are the differences in the Zambra styles? If Zambras were so popular, why did Zambra became an art in danger of extinction, what happened?

  With your generous contributions, we will develop The Zambra Online Resource Center to answer the important questions the international Zambra community is asking while producing additional resources for further study.

 
The Zambra Center will include:

  1. Authentic Zambra music
  2. Zambra and Danza Mora musical scores
  3. Collector’s item historic photographs
  4. Rare footage from old films
  5. Spellbinding artwork and etchings
  6. Articles about the intriguing history of Zambra
  7. Essays about ethnography and culture
  8. Historical chronologies
  9. Free Zambra Dance Lesson
  10. Short films and digitial storytelling
  11. Tributes to famous Zambra performers
  12. Homage to major Zambra composers
  13. Zambra Lyrics with Translation
  14. International Directory of Zambra dancers, musicians and scholars
  15. References for further study
  16. Space to ask questions and share answers
  17. Priceless Bonus! - Fascinating interviews with distinguished scholars and Gypsy patriarchs.

What You Get

In supporting this project, you get substantial rewards with a higher monetary value than the suggested contribution. For as little as $45, you will have access to the Zambra Center where you can enjoy exciting, fresh content being uploaded, even while we develop the project!

We’ve created perks and tiers to fit every budget and need! In addition to access to the Zambra Center, rewards include unique online dance courses, professional level training for performers and dance teachers, lifetime access to all the courses in my online school, private lessons, and there’s even a week-long trip to Granada with me! Please be sure to read more about these exciting perks to the right of this page.

We appreciate all levels of support and no contribution is too small! If you feel inclined, please share our campaign with your friends and family! Thanks!

What We Need

Our campaign goal is only $5,000. However, to fully complete the Zambra Online Resource Center, we need to raise about $8,000. So, please donate what you can! Every little bit counts!

  The funds will help cover the filming, video editing, graphic design, web mastery, web hosting, translation and transcription services, copy editing, consulting, office/studio rental, and expenses needed to conduct research/record interviews in Granada, Sevilla and Madrid (Spain).

  We hope you are excited to become a part of this formidable project, as the Zambra Center is a legacy we are creating which will benefit generations to come, even long after we are gone from the face of the Earth.

Risks & Challenges

This is truly a labor of love and The Zambra Center is already a work in progress, but the biggest challenge artists face is lack of funding. Without your help, it might take me years to complete this project.  However, your generous contributions will provide the resources needed to complete this within months versus years.

From day one of this campaign, your contribution will allow me to start sharing with you crucial facts and remarkable information about Zambra which I have collected over a 20 year span through the creation of the Zambra Center

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you contribute to our campaign or not, you can still help make history by helping us spread the word by sharing the campaign on social media. Right below you can use the fun Indiegogo share tools!

  For those who would prefer to contribute directly by check, please contact us for our mailing address.

  We also appreciate in-kind contributions. Some of the areas we need help with include transcriptions, translations, text editing and video editing.  We can also accept donations in the form of a DSLR camera or other functioning technical equipment.

All forms of help are greatly appreciated! Thank you for making history with us!
story_txt:
Why Zambra? Why Now?
Forbidden for centuries, Zambra is a Spanish dance and music 
tradition of Moorish, Sephardi and Gypsy origins that has survived 
against all odds for more than 500 years to become a cultural phenomenon
 during the first half of the 20th century. Unfortunately, Zambra  (also known as Zambra Mora) is now
 an art in danger of extinction.


I am Puela Lunaris, founder of Dances of the World Society. Since 
1994, I have been devoted to researching and rescuing different styles 
of Zambras, especially the Flamenco forms I loved from childhood.I was born and raised in Montánchez, an ancient village in 
Southwestern Spain with an impressive Morisco castle, which used to be 
part of al-Andalus. The women in the village sang Zambras regularly. I 
have fond memories of dancing to Zambras as a child.
However, this is not just a personal quest. Zambra is an essential 
patrimony we need to protect because Zambra is a tradition of great significance 
for many dancers and musicians around the world. 
With your support, I will create The Zambra Center so you can benefit from my extensive research.
 
The ImpactThe Zambra Online Resource Center is one of my initiatives as founder of Dances of the World Society. Through DWS, I’ve partnered with organizations and individuals who are also interested in preserving dance and music traditions in danger of extinction. With their support, I am working to save the wisdom inherent in these traditions, such an important legacy to preserve for future generations.I’ve completed ethnographic field research in Morocco, Iraq Jordan, and Spain. Always fascinated by world dance ethnic traditions, I have also learned a great deal by dancing in the kitchens of families from Egypt, Turkey, Greece, Armenia, Lebanon and India.  The Zambra Center is part of The Chanelar Flamenco Project, which is Dances of the World Society’s program focusing on rescuing aspects of Flamenco in danger of extinction.To this day, Zambra remains a major Flamenco and Copla form and it is also a vital Flamenco tradition as represented in the Zambras Gitanas del Sacromonte.Furthermore, the Zambra Mora tradition has influenced outstanding classical composers and world-class guitar players like Maestro Sabicas, which in turn have had an impact on modern day composers, such as Rob Mastrianni of the celebrated Beatbox Guitar. Latin Grammy award winners, Ojos de Brujo, have also chosen to honor Zambra.  Moreover, Zambra Mora has become very popular among bellydancers worldwide. It was because of the requests of my Bellydance students, I produced my first Zambra educational video in 2002. It’s now time to take it to the next level. I receive emails from dancers around the world asking questions like: Why was Zambra Mora forbidden? Who forbade them?  What are the differences in the Zambra styles? If Zambras were so popular, why did Zambra became an art in danger of extinction, what happened?  With your generous contributions, we will develop The Zambra Online Resource Center to answer the important questions the international Zambra community is asking while producing additional resources for further study. The Zambra Center will include:


Authentic Zambra music
Zambra and Danza Mora musical scores
Collector’s item historic photographs
Rare footage from old films
Spellbinding artwork and etchings
Articles about the intriguing history of Zambra
Essays about ethnography and culture
Historical chronologies
Free Zambra Dance Lesson
Short films and digitial storytelling
Tributes to famous Zambra performers
Homage to major Zambra composers
Zambra Lyrics with Translation
International Directory of Zambra dancers, musicians and scholars

References for further study
Space to ask questions and share answers
Priceless Bonus! - Fascinating interviews with distinguished scholars and Gypsy patriarchs.




What You Get
In supporting this project, you get substantial rewards with a higher monetary value than the suggested contribution. For as little as $45, you will have access to the Zambra Center where you can enjoy exciting, fresh content being uploaded, even while we develop the project! We’ve created perks and tiers to fit every budget and need! In addition to access to the Zambra Center, rewards include unique online dance courses, professional level training for performers and dance teachers, lifetime access to all the courses in my online school, private lessons, and there’s even a week-long trip to Granada with me! Please be sure to read more about these exciting perks to the right of this page. We appreciate all levels of support and no contribution is too small! If you feel inclined, please share our campaign with your friends and family! Thanks!What We Need Our campaign goal is only $5,000. However, to fully complete the Zambra Online Resource Center, we need to raise about $8,000. So, please donate what you can! Every little bit counts!  The funds will help cover the filming, video editing, graphic design, web mastery, web hosting, translation and transcription services, copy editing, consulting, office/studio rental, and expenses needed to conduct research/record interviews in Granada, Sevilla and Madrid (Spain).  We hope you are excited to become a part of this formidable project, as the Zambra Center is a legacy we are creating which will benefit generations to come, even long after we are gone from the face of the Earth.

Risks & ChallengesThis is truly a labor of love and The Zambra Center is already a work in progress, but the biggest challenge artists face is lack of funding. Without your help, it might take me years to complete this project.  However, your generous contributions will provide the resources needed to complete this within months versus years.From day one of this campaign, your contribution will allow me to start sharing with you crucial facts and remarkable information about Zambra which I have collected over a 20 year span through the creation of the Zambra Center 

Other Ways You Can HelpWhether you contribute to our campaign or not, you can still help make history by helping us spread the word by sharing the campaign on social media. Right below you can use the fun Indiegogo share tools!  For those who would prefer to contribute directly by check, please contact us for our mailing address.  We also appreciate in-kind contributions. Some of the areas we need help with include transcriptions, translations, text editing and video editing.  We can also accept donations in the form of a DSLR camera or other functioning technical equipment.All forms of help are greatly appreciated! Thank you for making history with us!

story:
Welcome to Our Funding Page!

Hella Theatre Company is a company co-founded by a dedicated and talented group of Columbia College Chicago theatre students that feel it is important to create art without boundaries. So, we thought out a show, wrote it down, cast it, and are going to put it on in February! 

 This show is called SHELTER.  This production is a site specific, experimental theatre piece about people staying the night in a homeless shelter. The production tells the stories of the lives of various characters. The characters are angry, sad, loving, and passionate. However, what we want you to see is that they're just ordinary people in a difficult situation. Many of you know them and might even be one yourself. This show is about what makes people who they are and why we do the things we do.

Of course, there's also a goat. Because everything is better with farm animals.

This campaign is extremely important. We at Hella Theatre Company are dedicated to producing and creating art that has an impact. We mean to impact your mind, heart, and soul. We hope our show will cause you to open and expand your view of your world around you.

 We want you to leave this experience with an solid opinion about what you saw. Good, bad or indifferent, we are going to have an impact. Maybe you will be changed. We hope so. We are spreading awareness of homelessness in Chicago, our city, people we may see everyday, and around the globe, we know that this show will spread that awareness to you. Thank you for taking the time to be a part of Hella Theatre Company’s production of SHELTER, coming in February 2015.

 

Our Production Budget is below. Thank you for your contribution.  


Set

 

$150

 

Costumes

 

$125

 

Lights

 

$25

 

Props

 

$50

 

Makeup

 

$50

 

Hair

 

$50

 

Promotional Posters

 

$50

 



Total 

$500

 





20% of whatever money is left over will be going towards Hella Theatre Company's next production! 

 

To make a show happen costs and we have some unique expenses. These can be paid for with the many perks we are including when you donate! These include:

The Honorable Mention Perk

The Insider Perk

The Free Ticket + DVD Perk

Lobby Display Perk

The Secret Perk

The VIP Perk

Take a look at these perks and decide which ones appeal to you!

Whatever extra money we end up not using on the show expenses, will be donated to a needy homeless shelter in Chicago, Illinois.

Even if you cannot donate, please help us spread the word on this campaign. Our dedication to this thought provoking production will be a revelation. 

Remember to SHARE, POST, TWEET OR SNAP, EVEN INSTAGRAM. THANK YOU!!!

story:
WHO WE ARE

 We are the Third Rail Mentorship Company (TRMC), a group of fourteen up-and-coming actors, directors, designers, writers, and technicians finishing up our yearlong residency with Third Rail Repertory Theatre in Portland, Oregon. Over the past year, we have been soaking up every bit of savvy we can from our mentors to develop our individual crafts and build our ensemble. Now we are preparing to go out with a bang by producing our final project as a company: a fortnight festival of theatre featuring the talents of our entire company. In other words... We're gearing up to go Off The Rails!

WHAT WE'RE DOING
Off The Rails is two weeks jam-packed with theatre. It will include three one-act plays directed by three of our directors, a staged reading of a new work by our resident playwright, and talkbacks after each show. This will be our final performance as a company as our mentorship year with Third Rail comes to a conclusion. We couldn't be more psyched to show Portland the depth and range of our collective talents.

BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP!
At TRMC, we are the epitome of working artists. We work day jobs, night jobs, odd jobs... all to support our pursuit of professional theatre. And while we are proud to facilitate all aspects of this project ourselves, we have limited resources. In order to produce our shows at the caliber we know we are capable of, we need your support.  

HOW TO SUPPORT US

Our goal is to raise $3,500 over the next couple weeks. This would help us cover some of the costs of:
-Venue rental
-Copyright fees
-Sets, costumes, props, lights, and other materials necessary for the production
-Marketing and outreach materials

Keep in mind, we are a 501-(c)(3) so all your donations are tax deductible!
NO MATTER THE SIZE, YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL HELP US GET THIS FESTIVAL OFF THE GROUND!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 -COME SEE OUR WORK!
Off The Rails kicks off June 18th and runs through June 28th, 2015 at Action/Adventure Theatre, located at 1050 SE Clinton St., Portland, OR  97202.
Tickets are on sale now! For a full festival line-up and tickets, visit: http://thirdrailrep.org/mentorship-program/off-the-rails-festival/
Or  call our box office at 503-235-1101 to make reservations!

-FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA!
'Like' the Third Rail Mentorship Company Facebook Page for the most up-to-date information on our projects.
Visit our YouTube Channel to watch our Meet-A-Mentee videos and check out our website to get to know us.

-SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN
Every time you share our Indiegogo campaign link, our exposure multiplies. We thank you for all of your help!

story:
Dance Girl's Story

Savanna Ikner is a 8 year old girl from Southern Illinois who dances on the Extreme Kids Dance Company competitive team.  She has danced on the team for 3 years and it is growing and getting better everyday! This competition season Savvy won a partial scholarship to attend a Summer Dance Intensive program in Californa! It is a full week of dance from 8 am-8pm EVERYDAY and plenty of fun dance activities to attend all week!

Dancer Palooza is the summer intensive Savanna is invited to attend. DancerPalooza is a one-of-a-kind dance festival that no dancer can miss! Located in  Long Beach, CA, DancerPalooza offers dancers the most comprehensive dance experience imaginable. Savanna is in Palooza Party whch is specifically geared towards dancers ages 7-12. She will take Jazz, Contemporary, Musical Theater and Hip Hop classes every morning! Each afternoon dancers will be rehearsing for the closing Palooza Party! Savanna will have the opportunity to participate in all the activities including but not limited to; 

  • 20+ hours of Palooza Party classes and rehearsals
  • Special Palooza Party Performance!
  • Swag bag
  • 36+ Crash Course classes to choose from
  • Admission to Beat Street
  • PLUS PALOOZA PARTY SPECIAL EVENTS
  • Solo Showcase 
  • Best Friends Night
  • Game Night & Dance Party!
  • Special Themed Days
  • Pool Party
  • And MORE!

This opportunity is not given to all girls in fact Savanna was the only girl from her dance studio who won a scholarship to attend! She is so excited to attend and learn dance from so many talented choreographers that she talks all day and night only about the scholarship and dancing in California.  This is an opportunity of a lifetime for a little girl from a small city with BIG dreams. Savvy has fundraised for her other competitions, costumes etc. all year and now we are trying to get her to the next opportunity...whatever you can do to help this little girl reach her dream would be greatly appreciated!

Help us help our baby girl...you will have our deepest gratitude!

Travel Breakdown and Dates:

Savanna is reaching for $4200.00 that covers the rest of her travel expenses:

  • Hotel= 1600.00 (with taxes)
  • Meals, Flight & Car Rental= 2000.00
  • Rest of Program Cost = 600.00

Savanna will use all funds toward her trip which is speedily approaching on August 1st, 2017- August 6th, 2017. Please help Savanna reach her goal and even if you cannot donate any money please donate a few moments of time and spread the word! All ways of contribution help!!!

Risks & Challenges

There is very little risk involved in this Help Savanna Dance Campaign. Every piece of funding received will go to help Savanna's dance. As a growing dancer, she has little experience in dance classes in other areas so this will definitely incease her dance knowledge and help tremendously in her growth as a dancer.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but are interested in helping, please consider share information about this indiegogo campaign with your friends, family, co-workers or pets.

story:
OUR VISION

In the 1960s a movement began. Young, talented theater artists came together to create their work outside of the commercial producing establishment of the Broadway theaters. 

Caffe Cino, La MaMa, Circle Rep, and many more were formed. 

This Downtown Theater movement allowed for some of the most important work of the American Theater to occur. This movement became the off-Broadway community that is so vital to theater artists.

We look to this movement as a source of inspiration and propose to take the baton and begin a new movement.

THE UPTOWN THEATER MOVEMENT

The northern region of Manhattan is an area exploding with creative artists. 

This is the place of the Harlem Renaissance. It has always been a cradle of revolution, change, and provocation.

Currently, in Hamilton Heights in particular, we see a new confluence of talented theater artists and a changing physical landscape.

As the neighborhood has grown to include many restaurants, bars, and art galleries, the need for theater is imperative. THE NATIONAL THEATER OF UPTOWN fills this need.

As a group of artists with unique visions of dramatic story telling, we have a distinct plan for the productions we create.

We will seek out and transform vacant buildings, storefronts, warehouses, rooftops into performance spaces. By building our sets in entirely empty spaces, we create complete theatrical experiences.

We create grand, theatrical events that lift, enlighten, and enliven the lives of the audience. Theater is a place where one goes to experience something beyond themselves and that is what we provide.

Our aesthetic is character driven, explosive, heightened plays.

As we simplify the elements of theater, a purity of dramatic storytelling is revealed.

This simplification extends to our process. We develop and produce our plays swiftly and economically in order to respond to the political and social landscape immediately.   

Our development process puts the artist at the fore, allowing us to present a pure, unadulterated artistic vision to the world.

This is the mark of the Uptown Theater Movement.

 

WHAT WE NEED

As we embark on the formation of this company it is essential that we find the financial means necessary to make our work as powerfully as we envision.

In order to create our inaugural production and advance the company’s strategic plan, our budget is $30,000.  It’s a challenging yet achievable goal and that’s where you, our community of fellow artists and supporters, come into play.  Every bit helps.  

YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL ACHIEVE

- Rehearsal and Performance space rental for our first production.

- Marketing and Public Relations for the formation of the company.

- Designer and Set Construction costs.

- Actor, Stage Manager, Designer, and Production Staff salaries.

- A foundation of financial stability to ensure that the vision of the Uptown Theater Movement propels into the future.

 

A REVOLUTION

Making theater is an act of rebellion.

Making a theater company is a revolution.

Come join the revolution.

 

Artistic Leaders

NATHAN CANN received his MFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU-Tisch.  While in school he was selected for Theater Masters where his play was produced in Aspen and NYC.  Upon graduation he received his department's award for Outstanding Graduate Playwright.  He's been a semi finalist for the National Playwrights Conference at the O'Neill four times and was named a Finalist for the 2015 conference.  His play, The Last Buckley, received a workshop at The Kennedy Center and was named a finalist for the 2014 Goldberg Prize.  He was also awarded the inaugural Richie Jackson Artist Fellowship.

 

CLAIRE BROWNELL is a New York City based actor, writer and producer.  She has performed on and off Broadway, in regional theaters around the country and is a member of the Amios Theater Collective.  Select credits: Broadway - The 39 Steps; First National Tour: The 39 Steps; Regional work with The Shakespeare Theatre, Hartford Stage, Pioneer Theatre, American Conservatory Theatre, Huntington Theatre, Arkansas Repertory Theatre, La Jolla Playhouse, Seattle Repertory Theatre, Gulfshore Playhouse, Florida Repertory Theatre, Palm Beach Dramaworks and Maltz Jupiter Theatre. Claire is a member of The Actors Center and a proud member of AEA.  She received her MFA from American Conservatory Theatre in San Francisco.

 

NICOLÁS MINAS is a theater and film director based in the Hamilton Heights neighborhood of Harlem, New York City. Recently he directed and adapted Carlo Goldoni’s THE SERVANT OF TWO MASTERS for the NYC based company, Sonnet Repertory Theater. He worked as the Assistant Director for the Broadway production of DRIVING MISS DAISY (with James Earl Jones and Vanessa Redgrave), the Assistant Director of Filming for the Emmy Award winning Live at Lincoln Center production of SWEENEY TODD (with Emma Thompson and Audra McDonald), the Assistant Director for the New York premiere of Sarah Ruhl's ORLANDO, and held an SDC Observership on the Live at Lincoln Center Production of COMPANY (Neil Patrick Harris, Patti LuPone, Stephen Colbert). He was the founding Artistic Director of Chicago’s Blindfaith Theater where his production of WOODY GUTHRIE’S AMERICAN SONG received 5 Jeff Award nominations. Training:The Pacific Conservatory of the Performing Arts (PCPA), Roosevelt University's Chicago Conservatory of the Performing Arts and Advanced Directing at the Eugene O'Neill Theater Center. Member of Lincoln Center Theater Directors Lab 2011 and proud Associate Member of SDC. He is currently pursuing an MFA in Film Directing from Brooklyn College’s Feirstein Graduate School of Cinema. www.nickminasdirector.com

 

LEANNE BORGHESI is a Cabaret / Solo Performance/ Musical Theater Artist currently residing in New York and San Francisco. She was recently an Equity Guest Artist at The Eugene O'Neill Theater Center Cabaret and Performance Conference, as well as The International Cabaret Conference at Yale University. Credits include solo works and cabaret collaborations “BAZAZZ”, “Accentuate The Positive, A Johnny Mercer Tribute” and Jonathan Brielle's, “40 Naked Women, A Monkey & Me” alongside such performers as Amanda McBroom, Lillias White, Penny Fuller, Marilyn Maye, Tovah Feldshuh, and Sally Mayes.  Cabaret credits: “BDSM: Beautiful, Dirty, Sexy, Me!”, “LUSH”, “B.O.O.B.S”, “The Anita Cocktail Hour” (Feinstein's at the Nikko, SF, The Duplex, NYC), “DIVALICIOUS” (SF/NYC)   Regional Credits: Mrs. Lovett in Sweeney Todd (Cape Fear Regional), The Servant of Two Masters  (Sonnet Rep, NYC),  Singin' in the Rain (Gateway Playhouse, NYC), Mr. Irresistible (La Mama. NYC), The Secret Garden (Theatreworks, CA), Spelling Bee (Center Rep) Eccentricities of a Nightingale (The Aurora), Nancy in Oliver (PCPA Theaterfest). Currently training with the Upright Citizens Brigade, NYC, and proud member of Actors Equity.  www.LeanneBorghesi.com

Young, talented theater artists came together to create their work outside of the commercial producing establishment of the Broadway theaters. Caffe Cino, La MaMa, Circle Rep, and many more were formed. This Downtown Theater movement allowed for some of the most important work of the American Theater to occur. This movement became the off-Broadway community that is so vital to theater artists.We look to this movement as a source of inspiration and propose to take the baton and begin a new movement.THE UPTOWN THEATER MOVEMENTThe northern region of Manhattan is an area exploding with creative artists. This is the place of the Harlem Renaissance. It has always been a cradle of revolution, change, and provocation.Currently, in Hamilton Heights in particular, we see a new confluence of talented theater artists and a changing physical landscape.As the neighborhood has grown to include many restaurants, bars, and art galleries, the need for theater is imperative. THE NATIONAL THEATER OF UPTOWN fills this need.As a group of artists with unique visions of dramatic story telling, we have a distinct plan for the productions we create.We will seek out and transform vacant buildings, storefronts, warehouses, rooftops into performance spaces. By building our sets in entirely empty spaces, we create complete theatrical experiences.We create grand, theatrical events that lift, enlighten, and enliven the lives of the audience. Theater is a place where one goes to experience something beyond themselves and that is what we provide.Our aesthetic is character driven, explosive, heightened plays.As we simplify the elements of theater, a purity of dramatic storytelling is revealed.This simplification extends to our process. We develop and produce our plays swiftly and economically in order to respond to the political and social landscape immediately.   Our development process puts the artist at the fore, allowing us to present a pure, unadulterated artistic vision to the world.This is the mark of the Uptown Theater Movement. WHAT WE NEEDAs we embark on the formation of this company it is essential that we find the financial means necessary to make our work as powerfully as we envision.In order to create our inaugural production and advance the company’s strategic plan, our budget is $30,000.  It’s a challenging yet achievable goal and that’s where you, our community of fellow artists and supporters, come into play.  Every bit helps.  YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL ACHIEVE- Rehearsal and Performance space rental for our first production.- Marketing and Public Relations for the formation of the company.- Designer and Set Construction costs.- Actor, Stage Manager, Designer, and Production Staff salaries.- A foundation of financial stability to ensure that the vision of the Uptown Theater Movement propels into the future. A REVOLUTION Making theater is an act of rebellion.Making a theater company is a revolution.Come join the revolution. Artistic LeadersNATHAN CANN received his MFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU-Tisch.  While in school he was selected for Theater Masters where his play was produced in Aspen and NYC.  Upon graduation he received his department's award for Outstanding Graduate Playwright.  He's been a semi finalist for the National Playwrights Conference at the O'Neill four times and was named a Finalist for the 2015 conference.  His play, The Last Buckley, received a workshop at The Kennedy Center and was named a finalist for the 2014 Goldberg Prize.  He was also awarded the inaugural Richie Jackson Artist Fellowship. CLAIRE BROWNELL is a New York City based actor, writer and producer.  She has performed on and off Broadway, in regional theaters around the country and is a member of the Amios Theater Collective.  Select credits: Broadway - The 39 Steps; First National Tour: The 39 Steps; Regional work with The Shakespeare Theatre, Hartford Stage, Pioneer Theatre, American Conservatory Theatre, Huntington Theatre, Arkansas Repertory Theatre, La Jolla Playhouse, Seattle Repertory Theatre, Gulfshore Playhouse, Florida Repertory Theatre, Palm Beach Dramaworks and Maltz Jupiter Theatre. Claire is a member of The Actors Center and a proud member of AEA.  She received her MFA from American Conservatory Theatre in San Francisco. NICOLÁS MINAS is a theater and film director based in the Hamilton Heights neighborhood of Harlem, New York City. Recently he directed and adapted Carlo Goldoni’s THE SERVANT OF TWO MASTERS for the NYC based company, Sonnet Repertory Theater. He worked as the Assistant Director for the Broadway production of DRIVING MISS DAISY (with James Earl Jones and Vanessa Redgrave), the Assistant Director of Filming for the Emmy Award winning Live at Lincoln Center production of SWEENEY TODD (with Emma Thompson and Audra McDonald), the Assistant Director for the New York premiere of Sarah Ruhl's ORLANDO, and held an SDC Observership on the Live at Lincoln Center Production of COMPANY (Neil Patrick Harris, Patti LuPone, Stephen Colbert). He was the founding Artistic Director of Chicago’s Blindfaith Theater where his production of WOODY GUTHRIE’S AMERICAN SONG received 5 Jeff Award nominations. Training:The Pacific Conservatory of the Performing Arts (PCPA), Roosevelt University's Chicago Conservatory of the Performing Arts and Advanced Directing at the Eugene O'Neill Theater Center. Member of Lincoln Center Theater Directors Lab 2011 and proud Associate Member of SDC. He is currently pursuing an MFA in Film Directing from Brooklyn College’s Feirstein Graduate School of Cinema. www.nickminasdirector.com LEANNE BORGHESI is a Cabaret / Solo Performance/ Musical Theater Artist currently residing in New York and San Francisco. She was recently an Equity Guest Artist at The Eugene O'Neill Theater Center Cabaret and Performance Conference, as well as The International Cabaret Conference at Yale University. Credits include solo works and cabaret collaborations “BAZAZZ”, “Accentuate The Positive, A Johnny Mercer Tribute” and Jonathan Brielle's, “40 Naked Women, A Monkey & Me” alongside such performers as Amanda McBroom, Lillias White, Penny Fuller, Marilyn Maye, Tovah Feldshuh, and Sally Mayes.  Cabaret credits: “BDSM: Beautiful, Dirty, Sexy, Me!”, “LUSH”, “B.O.O.B.S”, “The Anita Cocktail Hour” (Feinstein's at the Nikko, SF, The Duplex, NYC), “DIVALICIOUS” (SF/NYC)   Regional Credits: Mrs. Lovett in Sweeney Todd (Cape Fear Regional), The Servant of Two Masters  (Sonnet Rep, NYC),  Singin' in the Rain (Gateway Playhouse, NYC), Mr. Irresistible (La Mama. NYC), The Secret Garden (Theatreworks, CA), Spelling Bee (Center Rep) Eccentricities of a Nightingale (The Aurora), Nancy in Oliver (PCPA Theaterfest). Currently training with the Upright Citizens Brigade, NYC, and proud member of Actors Equity.  www.LeanneBorghesi.com

story:
Short Summary

With many people wishing that 2017 is going to be a good year, the UEA Opera Society strive to fulfil these hopes by producing their first annual opera. Without a music degree available at UEA, many of the students can miss out on developing their talents, particularly if the societies available don't cater to their particular style. That is why, after too many voices were not being heard, our president Poppy Damazer conspired to create our company. This was not only to help young musicians develop their vocal skills by attending master classes with the experienced classical singer Hannah Francis, but also to give them a real chance to perform. Hence 'Dido and Aeneas', a passionate and tragic story of love, power and treachery that relates to the vigour of modern life whilst letting you enjoy the fiction of the old.

As a company, we really just want to achieve something that differs from our degree and the general busy-ness that we all suffer from. And to do this, your contributions are essential to turn a small scale amateur performance into a professional production; with your donations, however big, our set and costumes will be eye-catching instead of bland, our audiences will be full and energetic rather than half empty. And most importantly, you will be proud of what you have helped to create. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We really want to start off our operatic legacy with a bang and to do that, we have decided to focus on the quality of the performance as a whole, rather than prioritising one aspect more than another. This is how you can help create our vision:

£460 for the venue We intend to perform at The Garage theatre in Norwich, a theatre keen to support local activities and sure to generate an interested audience.

£500 for costume, props and set- As the biggest slice of our budget, we are determined to make our performance visually enticing, from the mood lighting to the witches masks. To do this, we have employed the talented and award winning stage designer Lisa Ott who is already working hard to create a beautiful, atmospheric production.

£150 for Harpsichord hire- To create an authentic sound that pays attention to the context of 'Dido and Aeneas', we would love to involve this instrument, allowing a different texture in our music and a different sound in our opera.

There are of course perks, ranging from grateful acknowledgement in our publicity campaign to have your names recognised as our wonderful contributors in the programme. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge of doing a show with university students is time. Fitting 8 weeks of rehearsals around timetables and other campus-based commitments is not the easiest task; learning lines and music, constructing the set and coordinating with the band, all these things take up a lot of energy. Not only that, but this is our society's first attempt to produce an opera! But with a lot of planning, effort and hopefully your kind donations, we are sure to be proud of what we can create in such a short time. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, you are all invited to our performances, of which there are only two, so make sure you come along!  Also, please share our page with your friends, it would be greatly appreciated.

story:
Per Concessione di Samuel French Inc. - New York
Dopo il grande successo ottenuto Off Broadway per la prima volta in Europa il musical basato sul culto cinematografico degli anni '80 "Heathers - Schegge di Follia"

HEATHERS è un "rock musical" basato sull'omonimo film-cult del 1988 con Winona Ryder e Christian Slater. Dopo il successo di Los Angeles nel 2013, il musical ha avuto una produzione "Off-Broadway" nel 2014 altrettanto acclamata al punto che negli Stati Uniti, "Heathers" è diventato un fenomeno di massa.
Lo spettacolo tratta tematiche di grande attualità: bullismo, adolescenza a rischio, omofobia, suicidio. Argomenti profondi trattati con pensiero leggero e in chiave esorcizzante. La colonna sonora rock, originale e coinvolgente, accompagna i momenti salienti e momenti di passaggio con perfetta coincidenza. Attualmente Heathers è in scena in molti stati americani e in Australia.

---------------------------------------------
PROFESSIONE SPETTACOLO e ACCADEMIA PLATAFISICA presentano

HEATHERS THE MUSICAL

High School Edition - Versione Italiana


CAST - Personaggi e Interpreti:

ROSY MESSINA nel ruolo di Veronica Sawyer
LUCA SETACCIOLI nel ruolo di Jason Dean
ALICE GALLO nel ruolo di Heather Chandler
GIACOMO NAPPINI nel ruolo del Paul Kelly, Mr. Sawyer

Heather McNamara, Ensemble - VALENTINA SIMONETTO, VALERIA BORSELLINI, CLAUDIA PILOSU
Heather Duke, Ensemble - ELEONORA TOMASSI, CRISTINA GIACHI, MANUELA LONGO
Martha Dunnstock - SILVIA LIBERATO
Ram Sweeney - LORENZO PELLE
Kurt Kelly - ANDREA MEINI
Bill Sweeney, Big Bud Dean - LUCA VIRONE
Miss Fleming, Miss Sawyer, Ensemble - ROBERTA CANNIZZARO, MIRIAM TOCCI, CRISTIANA MORGANTI
Repubblicanette - Swing: MELANIA DI GIORGIO

Preppy Stud - Officer Milner: NICOLO' CAPODACQUA 

Produzione: ASSOCIAZIONE IDEA DANZA - Roma
Direzione Artistica: PROFESSIONE SPETTACOLO - ACCADEMIA PLATAFISICA
Social Media Manager: CLAUDIA GROHOVAZ
Adattamento in italiano: MARIA LAURA PLATANIA, BRUNELLA PLATANIA, MARCELLO
SINDICI, MICCHELANGELO NARI

 

Supervisione alla traduzione: ALICE GALLO, MICHELANGELO NARI

Acting coach: MARIA LAURA PLATANIA

Vocal Coach: BRUNELLA PLATANIA, ROSY MESSINA, ALESSIO INGRAVALLE
Direzione Musicale: SERGIO COLICCHIO
Coreografie: MARCELLO SINDICI
Regia Associata: BRUNELLA PLATANIA, MARCELLO SINDICI 

Si ringrazia per la collaborazione ROBERTO FAZIOLI

CONTATTI: Pagina facebook https://www.facebook.com/heathersitalia/

official website: www.heathersmusicalitalia.com

story:
Project Summary

7:1 was co-founded by Mannes composer, Alexander Chadwell and Rovaco Dance Company choreographer, Rohan Bhargava. These two young artists and entrepreneurs envisioned a collaborative performance project with three goals in mind:

  1. To provide current students at Mannes School of Music an opportunity to be commissioned 
  2. To generate exciting new works of music and dance through a collaboration between composers, instrumentalists, dancers, and one choreographer.
  3. To encourage young and emerging artists to gain a deeper understanding of a medium other than their own.

As a result, 7 Mannes composers were selected to work intimately with Rovaco Dance Company and choreographer Rohan Bhargava. After four months of labor, they have created 7 new works of interdisciplinary art that are now finished and ready to be presented! Come and support the achievements of these artists on Saturday, May 13th at 3 pm at The Auditorium on 66 W. 12th Street, New York, NY. Tickets are free but you can save your seat at: www.sevencolonone.eventbrite.com

COMMISSIONED COMPOSERS

  • Zachary Catron
  • Alexander Chadwell
  • Yufei Chen
  • Brian Denu
  • Stanislav Fridman
  • Michael Spiroff
  • Justin Rosin

DANCERS

  • Nico Gonzales
  • Mariel Harris
  • Jared McAboy
  • Sean Roel Nederlof
  • Hannah Seiden

What We Need & What You Get

This project needs $7,000 in order to meet its budget and make sure the performance is a success. Here is what we have to pay for:

  • 140 hours of rehearsal space
  • Hourly wages for dancers
  • Commissioning award for each composer
  • Payment for production staff
  • Costumes
  • Advertising (posters, postcards, graphic design, printing)
  • Documentation (audio, video, and photography)

By donating to this project, you get to support interdisciplinary art and avail exciting perks. We are offering benefits such as one-on-one conversations with artists, invitation to future rehearsals, an exclusive dinner with 7:1 founders, and even a weekend trip to Cape Cod with Rovaco Dance! Our goal is to foster meaningful relationships with our patrons and give them insight into our creative process. We want you to know that we appreciate all your help and support and we want you to be a part of our vision.

The Impact

Commissioning and collaboration are essential to an artist’s career. However, student composers and young choreographers are rarely offered opportunities to be professionally commissioned. Fewer still, are the occasions to collaborate across mediums. Music has always been inescapably linked to other mediums, and it has a formidable connection with dance. 7:1 nurtures this connection to stimulate artistic growth. It challenges composers to bounce conceptual ideas back and forth with a choreographer while dancers and instrumentalists learn to be present and engaged in a live performance.

More and more artists are discovering collaborative opportunities in contemporary opera, popular music, sound design, performing arts, film, and visual art. Learning the art of collaboration is a vital professional skill and it is only possible through a hands-on approach; 7:1 allows young artists to get their hands dirty.

Our wider goal is to engage the arts community to take a more active role in the creation and appreciation of interdisciplinary art, specifically new music and dance. New York City has one of the most vibrant arts scenes in the world, we intend to become a part of it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing our campaign on social media and spreading word about it goes a long way! If you know people who might be interested in supporting this project please tell them about it. Also, if you or your friends are in NYC-area then come show us some appreciation with some applause at our performance!

story:
As a Mancunian writer, I thought it was incredibly important to tell the stories I knew from growing up, and not the London-centric we see too often. A current student at Drama Centre London on MA Dramatic Writing, Conor has recently been put on both Theatre503's writer development programme, and the BBC promising writers after The F Word was longlisted by BBC Writersroom. 

Producing your own work is expensive for most as it is, but for those of us from a working class background it can be a huge deterrent in getting your voice out there, and consequently not telling the stories you feel should be told. 

The F Word  is a comedy drama exploring the wonder of teenage friendship and youthful positivity, even when the odds are set against you. We follow the friendship of two teenagers, one of whom is dying of terminal cancer. This isn't a story about death. It’s a story about life, friendship and a funeral. This is a play concentrated on their friendship and need for each other, Jacob’s cancer is simply an unfortunate addition to their lives.

Company and Cast

Conor Hunt - Writer / Producer / Director
Jack Tricker - Jacob
Evan Rees - Tommy 

We are looking to raise £2000 to go towards accomodation and travel to and from Edinburgh. Through blood, sweat and a lot of tears we have raised the money we need for the venue, however this was simply the first step in a very long journey.

We have ensured that all students and concessions will never pay more than £6 for a ticket in Edinburgh, making it one of the cheaper pieces of new writing. We have done this as we believe that in order to create work by and for young people you have to make it both accessible in story and price. 

Recent Audience Reviews from our rehearsed performance

“Moving, tender and funny”

“ Beautifully & sensitively poignant as well as witty, modern and full of awkward humour”

“Humorously tackling what is often portrayed a sombre subject matter”

“A heartfelt and meaningful snapshot of two friends dealing with an end”

“A rambunctious ode to brotherly love”
