story:
What is MASC In Wonderland?

As part of Moksha Aerial Studio Collective's (MASC) 2016 Grand Re-Opening, we will be launching our first major in-house production in our newly renovated training and performance space.  MASC In Wonderland is our take on Alice In Wonderland, with a circus panache.  Through circus arts and theatrical performance, we will explore the dark, edgy, vibrant themes and characters in Alice, while presenting a show enjoyable for the whole family.  You will be wowed and entertained by stunning aerial performances, daring feats of acrobatics, fantastical footwork from our dancers and breath-taking fire and juggling acts.  MASC in Wonderland will be coming to MASC Studio in Missoula, MT on March 11, 2016!  Check out our Facebook event for more details.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5,000 in time for our March 11th performance.  As this is our first major in-house production, we are starting from the ground up.  We will be using the funds generated from this Indiegogo campaign to:  

  • Produce staging and acquire set devices - including a multi-level stage for this and future productions.

  • Create costumes for approximately 30 performers.

  • Acquire and design props for the show, which may be used in future performances.

  • Compensate our videographers, photographers and original score producer.

As a donor, you'll earn awesome perks such as MASC merchandise, tickets to the show (or link to the live feed if you can't attend in person), your name mixed into the original score, or an opportunity to hang out with the cast backstage! 

Who Is Involved?

MASC in Wonderland will feature performances by our talented troupe of MASC Artisans, many of whom are class instructors at MASC Studio.  In addition to our seasoned performers, some of our dedicated students (ranging in age from 7 to 17!) will be showcasing their skills and talents in our production.  We will also be collaborating with our friends in Bozeman, Fire in the Attic, who are coming up for the show to dazzle you with their pyrotechnic skills!  

The Impact  

Missoula is home to many inspiring artists and performers and MASC is proud to be a part of this eclectic arts scene.  Through MASC in Wonderland, we hope to elevate contemporary circus in Missoula, as well as spread awareness and appreciation for our art form.  Contemporary circus is a relatively new art form in which stories and themes are conveyed through circus arts and theatre.  It combines traditional circus skills, such as juggling, aerial arts and acrobatics, with theatrical techniques such as lighting and stage design, original music and costuming.  You will see ALL of these things in MASC in Wonderland as we take performance art in Missoula to a new level! 

The show won't stop on March 11th!  After this initial production, we hope to present our performance at other venues in Missoula, and perhaps other cities in Montana.  We also plan to begin periodic recitals for our students to showcase their newly developed talents and skills.  Our Artisans are always always looking to share their passions for circus arts with the community and we look forward to creating more opportunities for our students to perform!

More About MASC Studio & MASC Artisans

The Moksha Aerial Studio Collective (MASC) is a training agency for the movement arts of Aerial, Flow & Fire, Acrobatics, and Dance.  MASC is home to the Performer's Guild, the MASC Artisans, a vibrant group of creative performers with a distinct and polished flair to entertain a wide variety of audiences.  Our optimistic, collaborative approach tailors each performance, with striking choreography and vibrant costuming, to the desires of the event producer.  

Our goal is to share our passions with others and make circus and flow arts accessible to our community.  We offer classes, workshops, gyms and jams for both Youth and Adults of all levels and physicality. One does not need to have the desire to enter the world of performance to enjoy the exercise and other health benefits MASC Studio classes offer. Our instructors are kind, qualified, experienced, and dedicated to assisting students to maintain or increase fitness.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, there are other ways that you can help!  Please contact info@mascstudio.com if you would like to make a non-monetary donation.  

  1. Spread the word by posting the link to this campaign on social media.
  2. Come to our Indiegogo Get Down Launch Party on February 5th!  See the new space, meet some of our production crew and buy tickets to win awesome raffle prizes!
  3. Join the Masc Artisans on Feb 16th for a special, live performance dinner at Caffe Dolce (5pm-9pm)!  Some of the proceeds go to our show.  Reservations are encouraged!
  4. Donate props, materials, goods or services to our show, raffle or pre-parties.  We also welcome any help with set-up, clean-up or other tasks at the show or during show preparations!
story_txt:
What is MASC In Wonderland?

As part of Moksha Aerial Studio Collective's (MASC) 2016 Grand Re-Opening, we will be launching our first major in-house production in our newly renovated training and performance space.  MASC In Wonderland is our take on Alice In Wonderland, with a circus panache.  Through circus arts and theatrical performance, we will explore the dark, edgy, vibrant themes and characters in Alice, while presenting a show enjoyable for the whole family.  You will be wowed and entertained by stunning aerial performances, daring feats of acrobatics, fantastical footwork from our dancers and breath-taking fire and juggling acts.  MASC in Wonderland will be coming to MASC Studio in Missoula, MT on March 11, 2016!  Check out our Facebook event for more details.    What We Need & What You Get 

Our goal is to raise $5,000 in time for our March 11th performance.  As this is our first major in-house production, we are starting from the ground up.  We will be using the funds generated from this Indiegogo campaign to:  

Produce staging and acquire set devices - including a multi-level stage for this and future productions.
Create costumes for approximately 30 performers.
Acquire and design props for the show, which may be used in future performances. 
Compensate our videographers, photographers and original score producer.

As a donor, you'll earn awesome perks such as MASC merchandise, tickets to the show (or link to the live feed if you can't attend in person), your name mixed into the original score, or an opportunity to hang out with the cast backstage!

story:
About Folio Theatre Company

Folio specialises in creating socially relevant new theatre, sharing stories that reflect the experiences of those people dealing with sensitive, often neglected issues. Based between London and the South West, we are committed to working in all parts of the UK, extending our reach to neglected rural areas as well as our big cities. We work with partner charities to develop exciting and important new plays with humour and heart.

Unearthed  is a deeply touching comedy-drama by Royal Court young writer Alys Metcalf, developed by Folio Theatre with support from Arts Council England, the Stroke Association and Carers Trust UK. 

"A touching glimpse into the lives of those left grappling in the wake of a shattering illness, it is a must-see. Unearthed is a masterpiece! - Swindon Advertiser

Unearthed had its first outing in 2015: a 5* sell-out regional tour of London and the South West, where the play is set. We are delighted to have been offered transfer dates for a larger scale, UK wide tour of the play in 2016. This is a wonderful opportunity for us as a company and we're so excited to share the story with a broader audience.

“Metcalf shows great promise as a playwright, writing about things that matter, while possessing a unique voice and vision”– Female Arts

Our 2016 tour will visit many exciting venues across the UK including: The Ustinov Theatre Bath, Hull Truck Theatre, The Salisbury Playhouse, The Cheltenham Everyman, The Shelley Theatre Bournemouth, Trowbridge Arts, and St James Theatre London.

 We are committed to sharing with story with as wide an audience as possible by keeping ticket costs down, reaching out not only to regular theatre goers but to all those people affected by the story.

"Bubbling with life and humour...a fizzing, fast moving script and a cast who can act out of their skins. What more do you need?!" Remote Goat

Our production of Unearthed has received fantastic endorsement from important public figures including David Suchet OBE ("Poignant And Heartwarming") and Dame Harriet Walter ("An Exciting, Up To The Minute Play").

What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise will:

- Pay for set, props and costume.

- Pay for travel and accommodation when on tour.

- Enable us to extend our reach by providing workshops for young carers and for other people affected by the issues in the play.

- Help us with marketing the show to ensure it reaches out to a wide demographic.

- Pay our hugely talented cast and creative team.

In return for your support, we have a range of exciting perks, including tickets to the show, signed programmes, drinks with the cast, workshops for you or your company, and even becoming a Patron of the Company. Everyone who donates, no matter how much, will be listed as a supporter on our website.

The Impact

With cuts to the arts becoming more and more prevalent, supporting the creation and production of new writing is tantamount to ensuring that areas outside of London continue to receive high quality, professional touring theatre.

Theatre is a vital medium for the sharing of stories, encouraging debate and handling sensitive issues. With this play we have a platform to engage people in  topical issues which affect so many but which are rarely explored. delve deeper into.

"Many parts of the performance I just wanted to shout out 'yes!' This is because as a young carer I could completely relate to the powerful story" - Carina Andrews, Audience Member

As an ambitious young company with many more exciting and important projects in the pipeline, we are extremely grateful for any support that anyone can give.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to support the project financially, then we would value any support you can give with helping to spread the word about Unearthed.  We are so grateful for every tweet, every Instagram post, anything you can do!

story:
Hello! My name is Aleksandr and I am an illusionist. To become a professional magician was my dream since I was a little boy. So, being 8 years old I started trying “magic things” and now, after 15 years, for me this is a lot more than just a hobby. This is what I want to move forward. With my skill I would like to show people how magical our world is! For this purpose I created a project called “Magic lives inside you”.

THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF 2 MAIN PARTS:

1) “Magic theatre”; children and teenagers with different backgrounds will be given a chance to learn magic performances and to become closer to their dream. 

2)  An illusion show; it will include new magic tricks I have been working on for 6 years.

WHY IS THIS SO IMPORTANT FOR ME?

I still can remember my emotions when I saw a magic trick for the first time. Since that moment, I always wanted people to be astonished by my skill. I wanted to ring their bells with my art. That is why I decided to engage myself in magic career. Nothing ever makes me so happy but when people start to believe in a miracle just like I did many years ago. 

Thanks to you support, children and teenagers with different backgrounds will be given a chance to learn magic performances, choreography, art of acting and much more. They will be participating in international magic contests. In other words, helping me with this project you give thousands of people a chance to believe in a miracle.

WHAT IS THIS “MAGIC THEATRE” ABOUT?

I organize charity concerts in orphanages, perform in child centers, but this is nothing in comparison with the fact that children will be able to learn this wonderful and mystic art themselves.

Just ask yourself this simple question: “When you were a child, did you want to become a magician?”

So,

1) There will be annual concerts in the theatre, where pupils will be demonstrating their progress.

2) Learning in the “Magic theatre” children will be able to participate in international magic contests.

3) In the “Magic theatre” children will be developing such good qualities as attentiveness, creativity, artistry and communication skills.

AM I CAPABLE OF CARRYING OUT THE PROJECT?

I have been mastering my skill for 15 years and, consequently, I have gained valuable experience and achieved noticeable results. Some of them are:

1)  2006 - I was accepted to the “Closed community of illusionists”.

2)  2012 - I won the second prize in Russian contest, nomination “Pop-Circus Art”, Moscow.

3)  2013 – I became a champion of Russia in “Pop-Circus Art”, Moscow.

4)  During all these 15 years I have been learning from the greatest magicians such as:

David Stone, France – an actor, illusionist and film director;

Henry Evans, Argentina – an illusionist, magic tricks champion of the world 2000;

Shawn Farquhar, USA – an illusionist, magic tricks champion of the world 2009.

To carry out the project at least 35 000$ are needed. All the money received will be used for processing papers, creating a web-site, renting of a premise for rehearsals, renting of a venue, soundman’s work, tailoring of onstage dresses for children, purchasing of handout materials for children to be able to learn tricks on early stages.

In case I do not have enough amount of money, I am not going to give up. Any money received will be useful to start my project’s carrying out.

Provided that you cannot help me financially, I would appreciate if you told people about my project in social networks such as Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. I will be pleased to know that you are in. 


Remember, miracles happen when you believe in them.

story:
TOES FOR DANCE recognizes the social, physical and economic barriers preventing audiences from participating in the arts. We are also aware of the tendency of contemporary dance practice to be esoteric and intellectually exclusive. Through our year-round activities (including our annual mixed-program production), we hope to engage communities in overcoming these obstacles. We wish to expose contemporary dance to new audiences and reinvigorate avid dance fans ; further, we hope to stimulate young audiences, empowering future ambassadors for the art-form of dance. 

This campaign is designed to support our 2015 mixed-program production, a spectacular smorgasbord of contemporary performance, titled "entrances and exits: an evening of short dances and excerpts", specifically our performances in Toronto at the Betty Oliphant Theatre on November 14th and 15th, co-presented by DanceWorks CoWorks. 

Funds raised will support performer/lighting designer/stage manager fees, travel/accommodation costs for our international guest artists and venue rental/theatre personnel costs. This subsidization enables us to offer affordable student ticket pricing, which otherwise would not be possible!


entrances and exits

The performance, a mixed program of 13 short pieces, will showcase performing artists from across North America in several short works by new generation and established choreographers from across the globe! The concert is curated to make dance accessible to new audiences by striking a balance between innovation and entertainment. Prepare to laugh, cry and think as you witness a wide spectrum of movement styles and physical theatre approaches influenced by other forms including experimental performance art, spoken word poetry, ballet, modern, hip hop, jazz and ballroom dance.

Throughout the concert TOES FOR DANCE artists will speak to the audience about important contextual information and provide tools for appreciating/analyzing the art on a deeper level. There is also a post-performance Q&A!

Collaborating Performers include: Maleek Washington, Ana Maria Lucaciu, Lea Ved, Thomas House, Mia DiLena, Sarah Fregeau, Scott McCabe, Callahan Connor, David Norsworthy, Kristen Carcone, Rebecca Diab and Justin DeLuna! 

Collaborating Choreographers/Creators include: Peggy Baker / Peggy Baker Dance Projects, Apolonia Velasquez & Ofilio Sinbadinho/ Gadfly, Riley Sims/ Social Growl Dance, Kate Wallich/ The YC, Heidi Strauss/ adelheid dance projects, Rosie Herrera, Liony Garcia, Scott McCabe, Callahan Connor, Jason Parsons, Fernando Melo, Kristen Carcone and Marie Lambin!

Learn more about the artists at: http://toesfordance.ca/about/team/

Buy tickets at: http://toesfordance.ca/tickets/ 


About Us

TOES FOR DANCE supports and develops the professional contemporary dance community by creating unique and valuable platforms for artistic exchange, public engagement and dance education.
Learn more about us at: http://toesfordance.ca/about/mission/ 
TOES FOR DANCE is an incorporated non-profit organization. Through our presenting partner DanceWorks (http://www.danceworks.ca/), receipts for income tax purposes can be issued for donations over $50.

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Tell a friend! Help us spread the word about TOES FOR DANCE, our events and this campaign... Share, retweet, forward-- or better yet, initiate a conversation!
  2. Contribute your time and support TOES FOR DANCE’s mission to enhance the accessibility of contemporary dance! Volunteer jobs could include, but are not limited to: administrative duties, Front-of-House roles, fundraising efforts, advocacy projects and research tasks. Alternatively, you might be interested in joining our Outreach Committee. Visit http://toesfordance.ca/get-involved/volunteer/ for more information!

story:
Zamboni is officially coming to the 20th Annual FringeNYC!

We did it! Zamboni is happening, and auditions are in full swing! We will know what theater we are performing in by the end of the month, and we will be in that space with our fully staged production in less than 2 months! (By the way, you should read up on FringeNYC at www.FringeNYC.org - it is an amazing organization and we are so honored to be a part of it this year!) 

If you already donated to our previous campaign, THANK YOU! You are the reason that we are able to bring this production to FringeNYC. Now, we are trying to raise the funds to ensure that our show is as great as it can possibly be! This includes:

1) The cost of rehearsal spaces. We are lucky enough to have a space to rehearse in the majority of the time, but during times it is not free we have to rent out other spaces. As we all know, space rentals in Manhattan are unbelievably expensive!
2) Giving our cast and crew the money they deserve. We originally included a small stipend for actors in our original budget, but we believe that our amazing actors, designers, stage managers, and run crew should earn more than the amount of a monthly MetroPass for all of their hard work.
3) Fireproofing our set and props (Who knew fireproofing was a thing? We obviously didn’t!)
4) Paying for our insurance. FringeNYC is generous enough to offer accident liability insurance at a discounted rate, but the cost was still slightly more than we budgeted for.

Any amount raised will help with the above costs, as well as covering any unforeseen expenses that come up during the production. There is no amount too small (or too large) to help!

About Zamboni: 

Jamie has resurfaced the ice rink for decades - frozen in isolation, unnoticed by the world around him. On the brink of his mother's death, he begins a high-stakes journey of self-discovery through a series of darkly funny and morally risky encounters.

Zamboni is a world premiere written by Sean-Patrick O’Brien and directed by New York Innovative Theatre award winner Leslie Kincaid Burby. This limited engagement runs August 13-25 at Venue #14: The Steve & Marie Sgouros Theatre.

Zamboni will star Drama Desk Nominee Joseph Franchini (The Navigator) and will feature Nick DiLeonardi, Dylan Martin Frankel, Dawn McGee*, Lucy McMichael* (March Madness, “Louie”), Mae Mitchell, Mickey Ryan*, and Lauren Slakter.

Zamboni features scenic and lighting design by Duane Pagano, sound design by Benny Goldmintz, and costume design by Chloe Heymans and Molly Tomecek. Kim Marie Jones* is the production stage manager, with Bronwyn Edwards serving as the assistant stage manager.

How you can help:

Obviously, you can help us out by making a donation right now! If you cannot make a monetary contribution at this time, there are other ways to help us out:

1) Please share this campaign with your friends to help us get the word out.
2) Contact us at 16-4424@fringenyc.org if you want to join our production team.  
3) And, of course, come and see Zamboni at the New York International Fringe Festival from August 12-28 (exact dates/times TBA).
story_txt:
Zamboni is officially coming to the 20th Annual FringeNYC!
We did it! Zamboni is happening, and auditions are in full swing! We will know what theater we are performing in by the end of the month, and we will be in that space with our fully staged production in less than 2 months! (By the way, you should read up on FringeNYC at www.FringeNYC.org - it is an amazing organization and we are so honored to be a part of it this year!) 
If you already donated to our previous campaign, THANK YOU!
You are the reason that we are able to bring this production to FringeNYC. Now,
we are trying to raise the funds to ensure that our show is as great as it can possibly
be! This includes:


1) The cost of rehearsal spaces. We are lucky enough to have
a space to rehearse in the majority of the time, but during times it is not
free we have to rent out other spaces. As we all know, space rentals in
Manhattan are unbelievably expensive! 
2) Giving our cast and crew the money they deserve. We originally included a small stipend for actors in our original budget, but we believe that our amazing actors, designers, stage managers, and run crew should earn more than the amount of a monthly MetroPass for all of their hard work. 
3) Fireproofing our set and props (Who knew fireproofing was
a thing? We obviously didn’t!)
4) Paying for our insurance. FringeNYC is generous enough to offer accident liability insurance at a discounted rate, but the cost was still slightly more than we budgeted for.
Any amount raised will help with the above costs, as well as
covering any unforeseen expenses that come up during the production. There is
no amount too small (or too large) to help!

About Zamboni: 
Jamie has resurfaced the ice rink for decades - frozen in isolation, unnoticed by the world around him. On the brink of his mother's death, he begins a high-stakes journey of self-discovery through a series of darkly funny and morally risky encounters.
Zamboni is a world premiere written by Sean-Patrick O’Brien and
directed by New York Innovative Theatre
award winner Leslie Kincaid Burby. This limited engagement runs August 13-25 at Venue #14: The Steve &
Marie Sgouros Theatre.
Zamboni will star Drama Desk Nominee Joseph Franchini (The Navigator) and will feature Nick DiLeonardi, Dylan Martin Frankel, Dawn McGee*, Lucy
McMichael* (March Madness, “Louie”),
Mae Mitchell, Mickey Ryan*, and Lauren Slakter.

Zamboni features
scenic and lighting design by Duane Pagano, sound design by Benny Goldmintz, and
costume design by Chloe Heymans and Molly Tomecek. Kim Marie Jones* is the
production stage manager, with Bronwyn Edwards serving as the assistant stage
manager.
How you can help:
Obviously, you can help us out by making a donation right
now! If you cannot make a monetary contribution at this time, there are other
ways to help us out:
1) Please share this campaign with your friends to help us
get the word out.

2) Contact us at 16-4424@fringenyc.org if you want to join
our production team.  

3) And, of course, come and see Zamboni at the New York
International Fringe Festival from August 12-28 (exact dates/times TBA).

story:
Short Summary

From What's That Spooky Noise? Productions, creators of "This is Boring, Nothing's Happening", "Playing Pretend", and "Shut-Ins" comes "GALACTIC": A new space musical adventure.

GALACTIC is the story of a team of dedicated space explorers trapped on a desolate planet while on a heroic mission. When their food supply is compromised, the explorers are left with nothing but their knowledge, wits, and each other to survive. At it's core, GALACTIC is a character-based story in an interesting setting, fuelled by fun, energetic, original songs and audio-visual effects.

The show will be performed in Saint John, New Brunswick August 16-21 as part of the Fundy Fringe Festival, and in Halifax, Nova Scotia (dates announced soon!).

What We Need & What You Get

Our $600 goal is the minimum we need to execute our vision:

  • $350 for venue rentals and festival entry fees.
  • $200 for art department: costumes, props, set pieces, makeup, audio-visual material production.
  • $50 for print and digital marketing materials.
This is in addition to the production team's own personal investments and further fundraising initiatives. Anything raised above the $600 goal will increase the value of the production.

The Impact

This is the third major stage production for Spooky Noise and this time around we really want to raise the bar. This is by far our most ambitious project and with your contribution, our vision can be executed lightyears beyond our expectations!

We can't wait for audiences in Saint John and Halifax to see this show, and with your support we also aim to have the production professionally recorded so everyone can see it!

Risks & Challenges

Putting on such an ambitious musical with such a low budget comes with many risks and challenges. We always aim to raise the bar with each production and this time around is no different. GALACTIC includes audio-visual elements, lighting and sound cues, digital projections, physical effects such as fog and lasers, and puppets. This is a lot for a team of 4 to handle, but with your support and our experience we can make it happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially? No problem! Your voice is just as valuable! Spread the word on social media using Indiegogo's built-in share tools, and tell your friends all about this awesome new space musical called GALACTIC!


Thank you so much for your support. See you in space!


GALACTIC

STARRING
Ryan Floyd
Sophie Nadeau
Deves Matwawana

PRODUCED by Ryan Floyd

STAGE MANAGEMENT by Ben Sutherland

BOOK by Sophie Nadeau and Ryan Floyd

ORIGINAL SONGS by Ryan Floyd

story:
This show is the result of a personal journey that began                                                                few years ago after someone broke                                                                                                                my heart

That was the moment I moved to New York City and I began researching and working incessantly. At that time I attached my heart to the wise acting coach Susan Batson.

This show explores Charlie Chaplin´s deepest intimacies, from his early experience with poverty & hunger that leads him to become the most beloved icon ever and the real human being behind the character.

What do I need to make it happen

$ 4.500

This is not a regular show

You probably know Charlie Chaplin and his movies but…

What kind of demons did he fight in his regular life?  How was Chaplin alone at home?  What is the source of his creativity?

This is a trip to the center of his heart,                                                 to the center of the human being heart

About Me (& Chaplin)

I´m Asier Kintana, an actor who quit a wealthy life a few years ago with a well earned reputation in sales, marketing and advertising to follow my soul. 

Working on Chaplin not only I discovered the human being behind the character but also it took me on a deep personal journey, teaching me how to drive from my heart. It was tough, really tough as I had to deal with my civilian life... but beautiful too. 

It´s funny that I began this project after a loving rejection, almost the way his genius began when he was abandoned by his mother, funny...

About Susan Batson

Susan is considered to be one of the most significant acting coaches in the world. She is a member of the Actors Studio and she coaches actors such as Nicole Kidman and Juliette Binoche, both academy award winners.

                                                               


Your money will pay for

  • Accent classes
  • Costumes
  • Rehearsal space
  • Hairstylist
  • Audiovisual designer and Photographer
  • Light designer
  • Promotional material
The Future
I already have producers interested in taking the show to Washington (US) as well as Madrid and Basque Country (Spain).

Where
                                                 Susan Batson Studio Theater                                                                                                                300 W 43rd St Suite 300                                                                                                                          New York, NY 10036                                                                                                                                Tel: 212 226 4630                                                                                                                (www.susanbatsonstudionyc.com)

 Vote

  Vote the show if you like it on nyitawards:  http://www.nyitawards.com/vote/

                                             

                            I don´t mind if it´s $1, $10 or $1,000, everything counts!                                                            Spread the word and follow the show on Facebook. 

                Thank you to all of you who will be supporting this life journey

                                                                        Asier

story:
Resumen/Summary

(Español / English)

“Compartir emociones, vivencias y mis recuerdos más preciados. Enfrentar el futuro desde otra perspectiva, totalmente libre y en armonía con la vida. Crearme nuevos retos y demostrar al mundo de lo que soy capaz, contarle quien soy en mi estado más íntimo”… así soy.

Hace más de tres años regresé de Sevilla. Bailé en distintos escenarios y con distintos grupos, dicté clases y compartí mi arte. Hoy he decidido enrumbarme en un nuevo proyecto, quiero contarle mi vida al Perú y luego pasear mi arte por distintos escenarios del mundo.

NADANDO ENTRE NUDOS es mi primera creación como solista, con nuevas formas musicales y un formato diferente para el mundo flamenco de mi país. Mi Director Musical será el Maestro Ernesto Hermoza, el mejor guitarrista flamenco del Perú, quien volará conmigo para la creación de la pieza que musicalizará esta historia, acompañando cada sensación en un escenario 360° jamás usado en el mundo flamenco del Perú. Ustedes, mis músicos y yo tendremos un encuentro profundo, lleno de emociones.

Me acompañarán profesionales de primera categoría. Desde Madrid llegarán para darle realce al espectáculo Mercé Grané, con más de 7 montajes en su carrera, quien será la Directora General, y Jorge Pérez, Director del grupo Patáx, considerado actualmente uno de los mejores percusionistas de Europa.


Una obra de esta magnitud no se podría financiar sin el apoyo de la gente que cree en mi y vive el arte de la música y el baile como yo.  Es por ello que he creado esta cuenta en Indiegogo, para que  puedas donar desde $1 y obtener beneficios. ​​

Este reto viene lleno de emociones fuertes, pero mi ilusión de hacerlo realidad es mucho más grande.

Giulia Risso.


"Sharing emotions, experiences and my fondest memories. Facing the future from a different perspective, completely free and in harmony with life. Creating new challenges and showing the world what I am capable of, telling who I am in my most intimate state”…that’s how I am.


I returned from Seville over three years ago. I had the opportunity to dance in different stages and with different groups, and also gave dance classes and shared my art. Today, I have decided to undertake a new project, sharing the story of my life with Perú and later on taking my art to different stages around the world.

NADANDO ENTRE NUDOS (SWIMMING AMONG NODES) is my first creation as a soloist, with new musical forms and a different format for flamenco in my country. My musical director is Ernesto Hermoza, the best flamenco guitarist of Peru, and we will travel together through the creation of the musical piece that will set the tone for this story, accompanying every emotion on a 360° stage never used in the world of flamenco in Perú. All of you, my musicians and I will have a profound encounter, full of emotions.

I will be joined by world class professionals. Highlighting the show, from Madrid we will have Mercé Grané as General Director, with over 7 mise-en-scène in her career, and Jorge Pérez, Director of Patáx Group, currently considered one of the best percussionists in Europe.


An artistic work of this magnitude could not be financed without the support of people who believe in me and live the art of music and dance like I do. This is why I have created an account in Indiegogo.

This challenge is full of strong emotions, but my passion for making this dream come true is far greater.

Giulia Risso.



What We Need & What You Get

El proyecto "Nadando entre Nudos" necesita $20,000 para poder montarse. El show requiere de un equipo técnico que lo cree, organice y promueva; vestuario, músicos, personal administrativo, entre otros. 

El éxito del show significaría abrirle las puertas a Giulia al mundo y otorgarle el deseo de volver a Europa a perfeccionar su técnica y aprender nuevas cosas; le daría la oportunidad de poder hacerse un nombre en el mundo artístico que le permita enseñar, crear coreografías y hacer nuevos shows junto a las principales figuras del Flamenco.

Todo el dinero recaudado por este medio será destinado al pago de la puesta en escena en su totalidad y, de quedar un excedente, a financiar un nuevo viaje para Giulia Risso a España, Argentina o Chile, donde más se práctica el Flamenco en el mundo. 

Contamos para este show con la ayuda y la confianza de artistas reconocidos como Mercè Grané, a cargo de la dirección general, Ernesto Hermoza, reconocido guitarrista peruano a cargo de la dirección musical, y Jorge Pérez, líder de la banda Patax a cargo de la percusión.


"Nadando entre Nudos" needs $20,000 to launch. The show requires a technique team to create, organize and promote it; dressing, musicians, managing personel, and more. 

The success of this show would mean the opening of the world to Giulia and granting her the oportunity to go back to Europe to master her technique and lear new things; it would give her a name in the artistic world that could lead her to teaching, creat choreographies and set new shows by the side of leading figures of the Flamenco world.

All the money we get through this channel will go entirely to the payment of the show and, if we get to have a revenue, to finance a new adventure for Giulia Risso in Spain, Argentina or Chile, countries where Flamenco is very popular.

Well known artists like Mercè Grané, direction, Ernesto Hermoza, distinguished peruvian guitarist in charge of musical direction, and Jorge Pérez, leader of the band Patax in charge of percussion, are working now with us and trusting us on this adventure. 


Otras Formas De Ayudar/Other Ways You Can Help

Si no puedes ayudarnos donando, por favor comparte esta campaña con personas que creas que sí pueden hacerlo y hablando sobre esta increíble artista que está luchando contra sí misma y contra el mundo para salir adelante y vivir de lo que le apasiona: el baile. Síguela en Facebook y comparte su página.

If you are not able to help us donating money, please share this campaign with other people that may do and spreading the word about this incredible artist who is fighting against her own fears and with the world to strive and live from her passion: dance. Find her on Facebook and share her page.

story:
Does Not Play Well With Others is a sharp new Canadian comedy and it’s heading out on tour! Award-winning solo performers Adam Francis Proulx (BAKER’S DOZEN: 12 Angry Puppets) and Kira Hall (Paleoncology) have teamed up to tell the story of two television performers who come under increasing scrutiny after a sex scandal hits their children’s television show. The Montreal Rampage called the pair, “Two beloved puppeteers of the fringe circuit!” The show premiered in at the St. Ambroise Montreal Fringe Festival:

“A polished, professional piece.” - Montreal Rampage

“Absolutely captivating. Proulx and Hall gave wonderful performances as both puppets and people.” - CJLO Radio

The two performers and their handy director/stage manager Andrew Young are packing up the puppets and heading West to Victoria Fringe and Vancouver Fringe. At its heart, this play is about the relationship between creativity and mental health and the team is eager to share this discussion with as many people as possible. Furthermore, an exciting accessibility initiative with the Vancouver Fringe will help bring theatre to a group who might otherwise not be able to enjoy it. To help cover the costs of shipping a show and its humans across the country, the team is doing this IndieGoGo campaign.


Here’s What They Need

The team is looking to raise $3000,which is approximately the cost to transport them out West and back with the show in tow (round-trip airfare x 3; set and prop shipping; travel between Victoria and Vancouver x3). The Fringes generously provide billeting for their artists. Show development costs, publicity costs, rehearsal space out of town, and other tour-specific costs are fronted by the artists because they believe in the project so darn much!

Should the goal of $3000 not be met the funds will be split between the team and added to the amount they are investing. Help them not have to eat ramen on tour!


Here’s What You Get!!!

You didn’t think these three wouldn’t be giving you some fancy prizes, did you!?

  • A pair of buttons (one Oomph and one Bae, the puppet characters from Does Not Play Well With Others)

  • Five hours of dramaturgy with Does Not Play Well With Others director and dramaturg Andrew Young

  • A custom monster puppet built by Does Not Play Well With Others puppet-builder Adam Francis Proulx


SO…

“Thank you for visiting the page for the Does Not Play Well With Others IndieGoGo page. We hope you can spare a little of your hard-earned dough to support us. We’re excited to share this project with audiences out West. We’re also excited about our cool perks and we hope you are too. Love and peace, all!” - Adam, Kira, and Andrew

story:
“It’s gonna be a great summer

And you can bet when it’s over and done

We’re gonna have enough stories

To last us all winter long”

– Lyrics from Baby Fat


THE STORY

Welcome to the online headquarters of the world premiere staging of BABY FAT: Act I: A Screeching Weasel Rock Opera. Here is where you will find the latest updates about the production, in addition to information about how to play a vital role in making this production happen. By becoming a donor, you will be supporting the livelihoods of all the working artists involved as well as being a part of history by contributing to this world premiere one-of-a-kind punk rock opera.

Here are the details:

La MaMa presents in association with Columbia Stages the world premiere advance staging of a November Theatre production - BABY FAT: Act I, a Screeching Weasel Rock Opera. BABY FAT: Act I boasts music and lyrics by Ben Weasel of Screeching Weasel (“Cool Kids”) and libretto by Ben Weasel (after Victor Hugo and Francesco Maria Piave). Michael Scholar, Jr. (The Black Rider) directs this ambitious thesis production, scheduled for a strictly limited engagement at La MaMa’s Ellen Stewart Theatre at 66 East 4th Street, NYC from July 21 – July 23.

With BABY FAT: Act I, Verdi's classic opera Rigoletto gets a punk rock overhaul by iconic frontman Ben Weasel of Screeching Weasel. In this world premiere, we find ourselves in The Reptile House, a Chicago club where the house band Serpentello and its entourage are at the center of a dark vortex of debauchery from which seemingly no soul can escape unharmed.

Of Screeching Weasel and about the production, director Michael Scholar, Jr. says, “I saw that one of my favorite bands was putting out a theatrical album. Listening to it, I got it right away and was blown away. I could see how this piece should look, and I wanted to bring it to the stage.”

Ben Weasel of Screeching Weasel writes about how excited he is to see BABY FAT: Act I come to the stage: “If I were British I’d be chuffed; a Californian, stoked; Audrey Hepburn, delighted! After thirty years of composing music and lyrics for rock albums, I can’t wait to take on the challenge of writing for the theatre. Michael’s track record in combining rock and theatre has gained my trust and confidence in his ability to bring Baby Fat to vivid life on the stage.”

TEAM


BABY FAT: Act I


Starring:

Russell Fischer                              Tommy Swank

Marlene Ginader                           Poveretta

Kwame Michael Remy                Baby Fat


And featuring:

Anne Bragg                                    Ensemble

Ryan Connolly                              Sardonicus

Matt Felkey                                    Ensemble 

Mallory Gladman                         Ensemble

Ryan Halsaver                               Zannoni

Darian Marchetto                        Ensemble

Maggie Politi                                 Miserella 

Dan Rosenbaum                          Stompanato 

Basit Shittu                                   Queeg

Alexander Tomas                        Jerry Japan


The band:

Keith Patchel                               Guitar / Keys / Band Leader

Mike Hunchback                         Guitar

Derek Swink                                 Drums

Billy Smolen                                  Bass


The creative team:

Michael Scholar, Jr.                 Director

Ben Weasel                                 Libretto, Music, Lyrics

Andy Peterson                       Music Director and Arrangements

Samantha Sheppard            Choreographer

You-Shin Chen                      Set and Props Designer 

Joseph Blaha                            Costume Designer

Oona Curley                           Lighting Designer

Conor Moore                         Video Designer

John Sully                              Sound Designer

Anchuli Felicia King             Dramaturg

Ran Xia                                   Assistant Director

Yu-Ting Lin                                Set and Props Associate

Jamibeth Margolis, CSA    Casting Director


The production team:

Kyle Cadotte                             Producer

Lucia Xiaoran Zhu               General Manager

Sipei Fang                             Associate Producer 

Joan Wyatt                           Production Stage Manager

Abraham Marlett                Assistant Stage Manager

Erik Kaiko                             Marketing Manager

Michael Leibring                   Company Manager


"While a handful of bands are prepping storylines for the stage, this may be the first opera in punk rock, and is a creative leap from the Weasel aesthetic.”
- Scott Murry, New Noise Magazine

Please note that Ben Weasel is not performing in this production of BABY FAT: Act I.


BIOS

Michael Scholar, Jr. – Director

Michael is the Founding Artistic Director of November Theatre, award-winning producers of The Black Rider. November Theatre credits include the cult punk show Hard Core Logo: Live and Ana (2010 Cultural Olympiad). Michael was the Artistic Associate of The Globe Theatre (Canada), where he directed David Greig’s Midsummer. NY credits include ILSA: Queen of the Nazi Love Camp and Uncle Vanya (Medicine Show Theatre); Mr. E’s Humongous Underground Digital Vaudeville Extravaganza!!! (Columbia University); and The Third Option (Amios/SHOTZ!). Canadian credits include Fat Pig (Jessie Award Nomination); Humanity and No; I Love You You’re Perfect Now Change; and 5 Women Wearing the Same Dress. Michael received the Canadian AEA Emerging Artist Award, and is a member of the SDCF Observership Program. As an MFA directing candidate at Columbia University, he was the Faculty Assistant to Anne Bogart. Most recently, Michael was the Intern Director for Robert Wilson’s production of La Traviata in Linz, Austria, and Robert Lepage’s Quills in Quebec. 

Ben Weasel – Libretto, Music, Lyrics

Weasel is the founder, singer and songwriter of legendary Chicago pop-punk band Screeching Weasel, which has released 12 studio albums. Weasel has also released two solo albums as well as five albums with the now-defunct Riverdales. All told, he’s sold over a million records. As prolific a writer of essays and prose as songs, he has been a columnist for MaximumRockNRoll, Hit List and Jersey Beat and has published the novel Like Hell as well as Punk is a Four-Letter Word, a collection of his essays and columns. He founded and ran Panic Button Records, acted in Bruce LaBruce’s Super 8 1⁄2, and once interviewed Kurt Cobain while the latter pretended to throw his baby daughter out of a third-floor window. He now resides outside Madison, WI. He is a fan of the opera, Shakespeare, and Sophocles, enjoys single-malt Speyside whiskies and fine Nicaraguan cigars, and he smells terrific.

November Theatre is a Canadian-based production company committed to producing and creating alternative musicals with a heightened performance style, incorporating elements of text, movement and song.  November Theatre is best known for producing the World English premiere of Robert Wilson, Tom Waits and William S Burroughs’ The Black Rider which toured across North America for over a decade - including a sell-out run at the Henry Street Settlement in 1999. This critically acclaimed production won dozens of awards including “Best Direction” at the NY Fringe. November Theatre also produced the stage adaptation of the punk film and book Hard Core Logo with new music commissioned from Joe “Shithead” Keithley of D.O.A. Since Artistic Director Michael Scholar, Jr. has relocated to NY, November has produced several local productions including the US premiere of ILSA Queen of the Nazi Love Camp and Annie Baker’s Uncle Vanya at Medicine Show Theatre. www.novembertheatre.com

An integral part of New York City’s cultural landscape, La MaMa has a worldwide reputation for producing daring work in theater, dance, performance art, and music that defies form and transcends boundaries of language, race, and culture. Founded in 1961 by theater pioneer and legend Ellen Stewart, La MaMa is a global organization with creative partners and dedicated audiences around the world. La MaMa presents an average of 60-70 productions annually, most of which are world premieres. To date, over 3,500 productions have been presented at La MaMa with artists from more than 70 nations. Honored with more than 30 OBIE Awards and dozens of Drama Desk and Bessie Awards, La MaMa’s programming is culturally diverse and cross-disciplinary, drawing audiences from all walks of life. www.lamama.org

Columbia Stages is the producing arm of the Oscar Hammerstein II Center for Theatre Studies at Columbia University School of the Arts. Columbia Stages presents annually a season of graduate actor and director productions as well as a festival of new plays by emerging playwrights. The Theatre Program at Columbia University School of the Arts offers MFA degrees in: Acting, Directing, Playwriting, Dramaturgy, Stage Management, and Theatre Management & Producing. For more information about the Columbia University School of the Arts Theatre Program visit www.arts.columbia.edu/theatre.


THE BUDGET

While this ambitious project is bringing together the artistic support of Columbia Stages, La MaMa, and November Theatre, we still need the contributions of superfans and progressive theatrelovers like you. By donating to this campaign, you can directly impact the look, sound, and feel of this awesome production. Funds that we raise through Indiegogo will go directly to the artists’ fees and production costs to make this event a kick-ass night for everyone.

Check out the perks to find what level is the best fit for you!

story:
About the Project:

OmFly ignites imagination, builds community, and promotes positive social change through performance and hands on experience in the arts of circus, yoga, and theatre. Every year, our community circus engages audiences and participants alike in a grand leap past the bounds of possibility to discover that we are all capable of extraordinary skills, creativity, connection and limitless success.  

OmFly is a decade long project, an inter-generational teaching & performance troupe and part of the New Circus movement.  



What We Need  

Every year, OmFly offers scholarship to three children in the community who deserve & need it most to attend our summer circus program.  Towards this end, we are looking to raise $1800 and an additional $1500 for new equipment.  The circus is asking for your help. 


OmFly programs are designed to:

  • Expand creativity, confidence, perseverance, and positive sense of self while teaching life skills that lead to experiences of success and recognition.
  • Promote health and physical literacy through diverse physical activity, motor skills refinement, and safe risk taking.
  • Develop powerful creative voices rooted in awareness, inclusivity, and justice.
  • Build trust, collaboration skills, and teamwork by creating nourishing environments in which to challenge fears and develop positive personal relationships.
  • Integrate art into daily life by making it accessible to all, especially underserved communities.
  • Offer artistic gathering spaces in which to dialogue, dream, create, and transform.

Fuel our Flight: How we’ll spend your donations…

In order to offer our summer circus to a diverse socio-economic spectrum, we need support for our scholarship program and new equipment.  Your donation is an investment in the future of OmFly, our community, and our ability to grow and thrive together. Here are some examples of what your donation will go towards...

  • Summer Circus Scholarships…....................………………………........3 @ $600 
  • Diabolos, Scarves & Poi………………………......………………………................$300
  • Comfy Landings--Crash pads & acro mats…………………………........1 @ $400 
  • We Can Fly--Trapezes and aerial apparatus………………………............1 @ $450 
  • Stilts ……………………………………………………......................................... 1 @ $350


The Impact 

OmFly has been offering circus as a tool for social change in the Connecticut & New York area for over 9 years, seeding this innovative fusion of circus and yoga to a new generation of individuals looking for truly effective practices of healing, creating and nurturing community.  With help from generous and visionary folks like yourself, we can expand the scope of this empowering work.


“Thank you, for sharing the circus with us! Truly amazing, uplifting, entertaining, empowering, great, great, fun! The children were so empowered being a part of it. Even my most shy one, loved to perform, and cannot wait to be in the circus again! You work magic, Jen!” – Jennifer Shafer Wood

“You all create an environment that is simultaneously exhilarating and safe.  The bravery and enthusiasm that you model – as teachers and community members, permits us to go big places.”   -Allison Baldwin

“Thank you again and again. Alexa learned more of what I’ve been striving for her to learn in two weeks, than in the last year.” -Larry Johnson


To learn more visit:

OmFly


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot support our cause financially, we'd be grateful if you shared this campaign with at least one person you know who might be interested. Thank you & may the circus be with you! 

Circus arts offer a powerful combination of diverse, integrated, physically expressive arts. Social circus harnesses this power to accelerate progress toward social, educational and health goals, “making possible what seemed impossible.” As a result, Social Circus is attracting researchers, funders and other community partners to help build an effective social change movement. 

Circus works.

Build trust, collaboration skills, and teamwork by creating nourishing environments in which to challenge fears and develop positive personal relationships.
Integrate art into daily life by making it accessible to all, especially underserved communities.
Offer artistic gathering spaces in which to dialogue, dream, create, and transform.



Fuel our Flight: How we’ll spend your donations…
In order to offer our summer circus to a diverse socio-economic spectrum, we need support for our scholarship program and new equipment.  Your donation is an investment in the future of OmFly, our community, and our ability to grow and thrive together. Here are some examples of what your donation will go towards...

Summer Circus Scholarships…....................………………………........3 @ $600 
Diabolos, Scarves & Poi………………………......………………………................$300
Comfy Landings--Crash pads & acro mats…………………………........1 @ $400 
We Can Fly--Trapezes and aerial apparatus………………………............1 @ $450 
Stilts ……………………………………………………......................................... 1 @ $350





The Impact  OmFly has been offering circus as a tool for social change in the Connecticut & New York area for over 9 years, seeding this innovative fusion of circus and yoga to a new generation of individuals looking for truly effective practices of healing, creating and nurturing community.  With help from generous and visionary folks like yourself, we can expand the scope of this empowering work.





“Thank you, for sharing the circus
with us! Truly amazing, uplifting, entertaining, empowering, great, great, fun!
The children were so empowered being a part of it. Even my most shy one, loved
to perform, and cannot wait to be in the circus again! You work magic, Jen!” –
Jennifer Shafer Wood


“You all create an environment that is simultaneously
exhilarating and safe.  The bravery
and enthusiasm that you model – as teachers and community members, permits us
to go big places.”   -Allison Baldwin


“Thank you again and again. Alexa
learned more of what I’ve been striving for her to learn in two weeks, than in
the last year.” -Larry Johnson



To learn more visit:
OmFly

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you cannot support our cause financially, we'd be grateful if you shared this campaign with at least one person you know who might be interested. Thank you & may the circus be with you! 



Circus arts offer a powerful combination of diverse, integrated, physically expressive arts. Social circus harnesses this power to accelerate progress toward social, educational and health goals, “making possible what seemed impossible.” As a result, Social Circus is attracting researchers, funders and other community partners to help build an effective social change movement. 
Circus works.

story:
Don’t Drink The Water captures the story of Janae Turner, a young restraunt owner who is still trying to find her footing 11 years after Katrina destroyed her family’s bar. Determined to revive the Lower Ninth Ward, Janae considers herself a rock in the community. With the help of her guardian and friends, she selflessly pours herself into the rehabilitation of her neighbourhood through cooking up some of the best food in the city. That is until a young rapper named Clyde walks into her bar. Head in the clouds and feet buried deep in the ground, Clyde is set on having a career successful enough to acquire a small beach house in Ghana. But after booking a gig at Janae’s bar, those clouds begin to clear, and his heart begins to fall for her. Things appear to be stable until an unexpected guest, looking for more than she deserves, finds her way into Janae’s bar. Love, greed, and a an imminent feeling of hopelessness soon begin to overtake the story, leaving Clyde and Janae with a multitude of choices, including moving away from Louisiana, revoking childhood promises, and giving up the bar. However, Janae ends up with more help than she needs, receiving guidance from a very wild collection of spirits ordered to protect her.  Set to a soundtrack of live hip-hop and soul and intermixed with the Creole and African traditions of voodoo, Don’t Drink The Water explores the damaging effects of Katrina, gentrification, and love, all while exploring what we chose to hold onto and what happens when we finally let it go. Through dance, song, a vicious game of dominoes, this play forces a confrontation of Louisiana’s past and present, leaving it’s future up for major discussion.

The money raised through this campaign will allow for a two day rehearsed reading of this play, which will provide industry contacts for both the actors as well as the writer. Proper exposure is key in the success of new works, and rehearsed readings have been known to be the jumping off point for many of the contemporary theatre shows we witness today. Your contributions will allow for a London based venue, production team, music rights and everything else that comes along with producing a new piece of theatre. All of the artists currently attached the project have put in countless hours to bring this play to life, and with your help, we can finally take our next step. No donation is too small, and with a list of rewards ranging form signed posters to drunken cooking segments, the incentive to donate couldn’t be more exciting! Also part of the proceeds will go to charities who's main goal is to rehabilate the Lower Ninth Ward in New Orleans.

 

We also have our campaign percentage incintives!

10% Funding the lovely women that run The Kitchen in Don't Drink The Water will make a Louisana favourite...DRUNK!

20% Clyde Can Cook? Janae and Clyde will struggle through making a very special peach cobbler!

30% Clyde releases a new track that will be featured in the play!

50% All of the songs in the show will be made into an album!

75% Writer Zuri Eshun will explain the very detailed history of voodoo and it's transfer to Louisiana...after a few glasses of wine!

100% A video of the full rehearsed reading of Don't Drink The Water!

story:
نخطو في مسرح خشبة، مسرحنا ومسرحكم المستقلّ في حيفا، الذي افتتحناه بتاريخ 1.10.2015، على عتبة موسمنا الفنيّ الثاني. اجتزنا الموسم الأوّل مع إنجازات مسرحيّة وفنيّة وحراك كان ملموسًا ومرئيّا للناس والتفافٍ منهم حول المسرح ومشروعه. لكن كانت هناك مشكلة صغيرة لا نريدها أن ترافقنا في الموسم الثاني الذي سيبدأ في شهر أكتوبر/ كانون الأول من هذا العام،وهي مدرّج المسرح.

قبل أن نفتتح المسرح، أطلقنا حملة على موقع "إنديغوغو" من أجل ترميم المبنى العثمانيّ في حيّ وادي الصليب المهجّر في حيفا، والذي أصبح فيما بعد مسرحًا، بيتًا لمجموعتنا المسرحيّة وللفنانين الفلسطينيين الذين يطمحون إلى تقديم إنتاجاتهم المسرحيّة والفنيّة فيه. علّمتنا هذه الحملة بخاصّة، وهون الناس من حولنا حول المشروع وافتتاح المسرح والسعي نحو استمراره، أن الالتفاف الجماهيري هو سرّ نجاح واستمرار أي مشروع ثقافيّ مستقلّ.

We are about to open the second season in our, and your, independent Khashabi Theatre in Haifa, which we inaugurated on October 1st, 2015. We concluded the first season with a significant theatrical and artistic success, and we witnessed a tangible and visible support to our newborn project from our audience. But there was a small problem that we do not want to it to accompany us in the second season, which will open on October/December of this year, which is the amphitheater.

Before we inaugurated the theater, we launched a crowd funding campaign on " Indiegogo" platform to raise funds for the restoration of the Ottoman building in Wadi Al Saleeb neighborhood Haifa, which we turned later into a theater, and a home for our art group and for Palestinian artists who want to produce and present their work in this theater. This campaign has gathered around us a great deal of support for the opening of theater and the pursuit towards its continuity, and this made us realize the important of the public support in the success and sustainability of any independent cultural project.

خدمنا مدرّج خشبة مدّة موسم عروض من ستة أشهر، لكنّ كثيرين اشتكوا من جلسته غير المريحة، والتي تستمرّ خلال العروض لأكثر من ساعة. بالمقابل، سمعنا وكتب لنا وقيل عن الموسم آراء مشجّعة ومقدّرة وتشرح الصدر. فقد قمنا خلال هذا الموسم، الذي حمل عنوان "حيفا بين الماضي والحاضر"، بإنتاج عملين مسرحيين كانا نتاج بحثٍ حثيث في تاريخ المدينة وحاضرها، ونتاج مختبر مسرحيّ دخل إليه أعضاء انسمبل خشبة، وهما" "ستّ بالأفّة" (عشاء مسرحيّ) و"سنة الثلجة". كما تعاوننا في إنتاج أعمال فنيّة صديقة، تبادلنا معها ثقافيًّا. كنا شركاء في مهرجان حيفا المستقل للأفلام بدورته الأولى، واستضفنا عروضًا في حقول فنيّة مختلفة كالموسيقى والشعر والسينما.

في موسمنا الثاني، الذي يملأنا حماسةً ونشاطًا، أولا كوننا مستمرين في مشروعنا الذي طالما كان حلمًا، وهذا ليس بالأمر السهل. ثانيًا، لأنّ الموسم، الذي يحمل عنوان "الهوية"، حافلٌ بالمشاريع المثيرة: كتأسيس الدورة الأولى من مهرجان "رَ" للعرض الأدائيّ القصير، الذي سيموّل اقتراحات مشاريع لعروض أدائيّة ويقدمها في مهرجان سيجوب حيفا ورام الله والقدس. كما سينتج المسرح عملاً مسرحيّا يضم فنانين فلسطينيين من مختلف جغرافيا التواجد الفلسطينيّ. هذا بالإضافة إلى الإنتاجات التي سيتعاون المسرح في تقديمها مع فنانين أصدقاء، والعروض المختلفة التي سيستضيفها.

Our current amphitheater in Khashabi had served us during our first six-months season, but many from our audience complained that the seats are uncomfortable, especially when the show is running for more than an hour. On the other hand, we heard and received a lot of encouraging and heartwarming reviews from our audience about our work. During the first season "Haifa between the past and the present," we produced two playwrights that were the outcome of a deep research in the city's history and present, and also the product of a theatrical “laboratory” that the members of Khashabi Ensemble worked inside it. We cooperated with fellow artists in the production of their projects, we were partners in the first Haifa Independent Film Festival, and we hosted exibisions and performances in various artistic fields such as music, poetry, etc..

On the outskirts of our second season, we are very enthusiastic and hopeful, first because we are sustaining and continuing our project which was a long-lived dream coming true, and not so easily. Second, because the next season, which is under the title "Identity", is full of exciting projects, such as launching the first edition of "Ra" Festival for Short Performances, which will fund the precaution of project proposals for short art performances and its presentation in Haifa, Ramallah and Jerusalem. Khashabi Theatre will also produce a theatrical work featuring Palestinian artists from various places in the Palestine and the diaspora. This is in addition to theater productions, where Khashabi will partner with other fellow artists in producing and presenting it.

أين نحن ماديًّا؟

إنّ المدرّج الذي سنقوم ببنائه سيكلّف المسرح ما يقارب 15,440 دولار أمريكي. تمكّنا حتّى الآن من الحصول  على جزء صغير من المبلغ الإجماليّ. لا نراه مبلغًا مستحيلا، بل نستطيع من خلال آيّ مساهمة من كلّ فرد منكم آن نحصّله.    

حضر الموسم الأوّل أكثر من 4 آلاف مشاهد. ونحن على ثقة بأنّ الموسم الثاني سيستقبل عددًا أكبر من المشاهدين المهتمين في المسرح والفنون بشكل عام. كلّ هؤلاء سيجلسون على مقاعد مريحة إن لم تمكّنا من خلال هذه الحملة من الحصول على التمويل الكافي لبناء مدرّجنا الجديد.

What is our financial status?

The amphitheater that we plan to build will cost approximately USD 15,440. So far we have been able to raise a small portion of the total amount. We believe that it is possible to raise the total amount, and any support receive from any of you will contribute to reaching our goal.

More than four thousand people attended Khashabi Theatre shows during the first season. We believe that more people who are interested in theater and art in general will attend the second season. It is very important for us to build the new seats in order to be able to provide comfortable seating for our audience.

اعرفونا:

أسّس مسرح "خشبة" بمبادرة مجموعة من المسرحيين الفلسطينيين الشباب تشكّلت كإنسمبل عام 2011، تعمل وتنتج اليوم في مسرحها، ضمن رؤية عمليّة في تحوليه إلى بيت للفنانين الفلسطينيين، من خلال تعاونها مع الأفراد والفرق الفنيّة، بحيث يكوّن هذا البيت مساحةً حرّة للتجريب والخلق والبحث، وقاعدة نحو تشكيل حركة فنيّة مجدّدة.

زوروا: موقع المسرح، صفحة الفيسبوك، موقع مهرجان "رَ"

About us:

Khashabi Theatre is an initiative of a group of young Palestinians professionals in theatre,  who coalesced into an Ensemble in 2011. This group works and produces today in Khashabi  theatre, operating under on the overall practical approach of turning this theatre to a home for Palestinian artists through cooperation with individuals and art groups, so that this home will become a free space for experimentation, creation and research, and will form the base towards the formation of a renewed artistic movement.

Visit: the theater website, Facebook page, “Ra” Festival website

story:
About the Company and the show

  •  My Name is Sofi Tenenbaum-Askenazi; I am the artistic director of Memoria Muscular, a dance company based in Mexico City that is introducing a different perspective in performance. Memoria Muscular looks for site-specific places that are non-traditional and less conventional for dance and creates projects that change the way people see dance in Mexico City. As artistic director, I try to find places that have a historical, cultural or social importance and collaborate with the space, the architecture, various artists and most importantly, the audience.  
  •  El Muro, is a site-specific collaborative project that deals with the many walls we as humanity raise when tolerance, patience and dialogue fall apart. This project connects with the corporal, emotional and intellectual fear of losing family, friends, territory, freedom and life as we face different internal and external challenges.
  • The performance will take place April 7, 9 and 10

Why we need your help!

  • As you might already know, dance gets very little attention in the arts, and small dance companies are left to fend for themselves and their budgets. As I am producing this entire show by myself, I need your help to raise $3,500 dollars to compensate dancers, and cover light/sound equipment and technicians who help with the realization of the project. And since the space is a non-profit, they are not charging me for rent but I promised to donate 20% of the entrance fee for the event. Ticket prices in Mexico are very affordable to encourage attendance, so they definitely do not cover all the extras we need to make this a special project.
  • Therefore, the $3,500 dollars would be used like this:
  • $1,500 goes to the dancers
  • $1,500 is for light/sound equipment and technicians
  • $250 for costumes 
  • $250 for documentation and promotional material

The Impact

El Muro, is a site-specific collaboration with the visual artist Mario Palacios Kaim and the Historic Synagogue in downtown Mexico City. This architectural gem was a very active place among the immigrant jewish community during 1930's to 1960's. In later years, as Mexico's jewish community moved away from downtown, the place stopped services and was left to collect dust. A few years ago (2009), the synagogue and the adjacent building where classes and community events took place, were rehabilitated as a museum, gallery and lecture hall. Yet, the ambiance, setting and personality of the building stayed true to its original years it was active. 

  • El Muro will unite dancers, visual artists, community leaders, and an introspective audience in very unique place and raise questions about who we are and what we expect from each other. 
  • Memoria Muscular has done other site-specific projects with a limited budget and no entrance fees. However, this time we are more committed to raise the bar and create a more complete and engaging show. 
  • I, as an artistic director, always pay my dancers because they deserve to be credited and compensated for their hard work, creativity, commitment and loyalty.  

Other Ways You Can Help

As this project will be performed in Mexico City, it will be difficult for many of you to attend, but we will upload a video of the show shortly after its last performance. If it is difficult for you to donate now, could you recommend us to your friends, acquaintances and family members who admire and respect the arts and would like to contribute? 

  • If you want to see more of our work log into FB:Memoria Muscular and like our page!
  • You can also contact me at danzarte71@gmail.com
story_txt:
About the Company and the show 
 My Name is Sofi Tenenbaum-Askenazi; I am the artistic director of Memoria Muscular, a dance company based in Mexico City that is introducing a different perspective in performance. Memoria Muscular looks for site-specific places that are non-traditional and less conventional for dance and creates projects that change the way people see dance in Mexico City. As artistic director, I try to find places that have a historical, cultural or social importance and collaborate with the space, the architecture, various artists and most importantly, the audience.  
  El Muro, is a site-specific collaborative project that deals with the many walls we as humanity raise when tolerance, patience and dialogue fall apart. This project connects with the corporal, emotional and intellectual fear of losing family, friends, territory, freedom and life as we face different internal and external challenges.
The performance will take place April 7, 9 and 10

Ticket prices in Mexico are very affordable to encourage attendance, so they definitely do not cover all the extras we need to make this a special project.
Therefore, the $3,500 dollars would be used like this:

$1,500 goes to the dancers

$1,500 is for light/sound equipment and technicians $250 for costumes

This architectural gem was a very active place among the immigrant jewish community during 1930's to 1960's. In later years, as Mexico's jewish community moved away from downtown, the place stopped services and was left to collect dust. A few years ago (2009), the synagogue and the adjacent building where classes and community events took place, were rehabilitated as a museum, gallery and lecture hall. Yet, the ambiance, setting and personality of the building stayed true to its original years it was active.   
El Muro will unite dancers, visual artists, community leaders, and an introspective audience in very unique place and raise questions about who we are and what we expect from each other. 
Memoria Muscular has done other site-specific projects with a limited budget and no entrance fees. However, this time we are more committed to raise the bar and create a more complete and engaging show.

story:
Howie the Rookie... 

The Howie begins the story. The Rookie concludes it.Mark O'Rowe's Howie the Rookie is an epic tale. A wild, urban odyssey through a nightmarish landscape, hilarious, grotesque and, finally, deeply moving and touching.

A kaleidoscopic array of characters including Ladyboy, a psychotic thug on a quest to avenge the deaths of his Siamese fighting fish. Malodorous adrenaline-junkies Flann Dingle and Ginger Boy, Avalanche, a ski-panted monster looking for love, the tragic Mouse, the scabies-afflicted Peaches. And the Howie. And the Rookie.

one hell of a story.

“Mr. O'Rowe...is fierce with talent... one of those rare, shiver-making instances in which language seems to become truly physical"

How did this happen?

Jared:

I had the opportunity to see Howie the Rookie while studying in Ireland in 2013. I was blown away. The ferocity at which the actor attacked the text. It was like being in a boxing match, but I didn't know who was winning. The language of the play at first was a road block to comprehension. Very thick irish/dublin accent. Shortly into the play though my ears automatically adjusted and I held on for a wild ride. At the end of the play I sat in the theatre crying and mesmerized by what I had just witnessed. Eventually the usher kicked me out of the theatre and I knew then I needed to direct this show. It's beyond a want. It's a need. 

I hope to recreate that same feeling I had sitting in that theatre that night. Completely transfixed and in awe.

Nevan:

"Describe the show."

One word: Kinetic

It’s Physical. It keeps moving, keeps building and doesn’t let up. You are thrown in at the beginning and it doesn’t let go for an hour and half.

You are going to go for a ride.

If I’m not exhausted and sweating at the end of each and every show, I haven’t done it right.

A down and dirty dark comedy.

It’s got swearing, blood, sex, raunchiness, tears…it’s got everything.

A very different show, and  a lot of fun.

Eleanor:

"What did you think?"

I was scared of it. And that’s why I liked it.

So peculiar and gritty and dirty and in your face. It's saying “I’m here and you better pay attention.”

Challenge yourself and you will be entertained.

Natalie:

"What did you think of the play after your very first read?"

I thought that this show is the kind of theatre that I've been missing; it is the kind of theatre that a lot of us have been missing. It is a thrill to encounter a play where the spectacle lies in such a rich text, that is fierce, shameless, hilarious, and oddly heartbreaking all at once. I was uncomfortable, and I immediately started reading it again.

"What do you hope people take from it?"

I hope that it causes people to consider the roots of theatre that was less about the big budgets and more about telling real stories. I was taught that the purpose of theatre according to the Greeks was to take events that were unbearable, and in putting them onstage, enable both artists and audience to find a way to make life bearable again. I believe this show is capable of such catharsis.

From the Irish Times:

“Mark O'Rowe is best known for the verbal pyrotechnics of his monologue plays, dark narratives full of spectacular imagery and linguistic experiment. In Howie the Rookie, his 1999 breakthrough, two young men narrate an odyssey through Dublin that is Shakespearean in its poetry and Jacobean in its arc of bloody revenge."


The Factory Theatre is here to create opportunities where actor, artist, and audience member all take part and revel in the shared experience inherent in live theatre. Seeking work that hits us instinctually, emotionally, and intellectually. Preferably in that order.  The Factory Theatre achieves this by focusing on what makes theatre an event to be witnessed. Choosing to remind us that we are all participants, audience and actors, taking part in real magic.

TICKETS CAN BE FOUND HERE:  Howie the Rookie Tickets

Meet the Team

Jared Lee (top left) Director

Nevan Richard (top right) Actor

Eleanor Johnson (bottom left) Assistant Director

 Natalie Mecham (bottom right) Stage Manager

What We Need

Theatre requires only three things to exist.

  • Something to say.
  • A place to say it.
  • Someone to say it to.

- We have something to say

- We have a place to say it

- AND WE WANT TO SAY IT TO YOU! 

And with your support we can bring this story to you. With your donation we can fully form this show as it should be. This show is a back to basics, minimal set, no props, lo-fi show. But even with that, we need your support.

Our expenses are small, but ever present:

- Rehearsal Space rental

- Performance Space rental

- Performance Rights

- Lights

- Set pieces

It is our hope that ticket sales will help off set these expenses, but we know ticket sales alone are not enough. With your donation of $25 or more you get your ticket for the show plus other perks. 

*If you were planning on going, or are now thinking of going, why not support us by prepaying for your tickets now and get some bonuses!

Where will the money go?

We have been honored with a fiscal sponsorship through Fractured Atlas.

Fractured Atlas is a non-profit organization whose mission is to empower artists, arts organizations, and other cultural sector stakeholders by eliminating practical barriers to artistic expression, so as to foster a more agile and resilient cultural ecosystem.

What does that mean?

EVERY single dollar/item given in support of Howie the Rookie is now tax-deductible through this fantastic fiscal sponsorship!

More importantly we have the support and endorsement of a fantastic organization that is doing good for the arts at large and is providing the mentoring for future plans and mission of The Factory Theatre.

                                                                           

The Larger Picture

Howie the Rookie marks the second stage in the larger 3 Stage Factory Plan for The Factory Theatre.

The 3 Stage Plan

 Stage 1: The Ensemble

In 2012 The Factory Theatre put on the English World Premier of Jean-Michel Ribe's Theatre Without Animals. This was show whole dedicated to the ensemble. It featured 8 different pieces all told through the ensemble of 5 actors. This was a perfect show to showcase the group, not individuals.  A strong ensemble show is a staple of any theatre's repertoire. 

Stage 2: The Solo

In 2016 with Mark O' Rowe's Howie the Rookie, The Factory Theatre will take on another staple of any theatre's repertoire. The Solo Show. This production will showcase the talents of a single actor who will carry the show on their shoulders. 

           

 Stage 3: The Event

In the final stage The Factory Theatre will take on a large scale event that will require support from many unlikely sources, in hopes of bringing people of different backgrounds, skills, and experiences together for a festival celebrating the event of theatre. 

By concluding this third stage The Factory Theatre wants to prove that regardless the model or type of show or event, we are capable of creating a shared experience and have turned spectators into participants.


Your support for this show goes further than just this production. You are investing in us and future theatre productions. Your support means that more of the ticket sales can go to the next big event instead of just paying of debt from the show!

Times tough? Can't donate? No worries, you can still help out!

  • If you don't have the means to contribute financially, don't worry! Here are some other ways you can help: 

    • Make noise! Share this campaign on Facebook, or whatever social media outlet you prefer. Word of mouth is the single best tool for theatre!
    • Send me a message (mjaredlee@thefactorytheatrepdx.com) if you would like to volunteer and usher. 

    • Still come out to the show. Support local theatre!

    Thank you again. And hope to see you at the show! 

    Howie the Rookie
    Premiering February 19- March 6, 2016  - Shout House
    210 SE Madison St, Ste II Portland OR 97214
    www.thefactorytheatrepdx.com/

                                 



Howie the Rookie is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Howie the Rookie must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

BREWVANA

(pick one to take, or get a new one painting just for you!)
