story:
About WildcardxFaust

For all of you who desire sex-positive entertainment produced by and for the diverse queer community.

For all of you who yearn for a show featuring heroes who are 

sex workers, kinksters, transgender, and people of color.  

We wrote a rock opera for you.

With this show, we seek to abolish stigma

With this show, we strive to send messages of hope

With this show, we intend on hosting two epic nights of inspiration, magic, and wonder!

Our story is revolutionary, and we need your support to make it happen.

What We Need & What You Get

Not only do you receive functional and beautiful merchandise adorned with our artwork… 

YOUR DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTABLE! 

Because our show was created by the queer artistic entrepreneurs of  Tongue in Chic Gallery, a fiscally sponsored project of Intersection for the Arts in San Francisco, you get to write off your monetary donation on your taxes!

Each dollar you give directly funds our artists, performers, and technicians.

$3,000 is a modest amount of money to cover a production this spectacular. 

If we raise $4,000, than we can cover the cost of our amazing set, costumes and equipment.

If we raise $6,000 then we can host this show in Oakland!

If we raise $9,000 or more we can go on a tour!   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, you can still help by getting the word out about about our campaign:

-Make some noise about our show by reposting our campaign on all your social media sites.

-Send a personal message to someone you know would be interested in donating to our project.

-If you have a blog, podcast, column in a newspaper, radio or TV Show, promote our project and provide a link to our campaign.

Find our more about us

You can visit our Fiscally Sponsored project, Tongue in Chic Gallery at

www.tongueinchicgallery.org

You can visit the official WildcardxFaust rock opera page and buy tickets at

www.wildcardxfaust.com

We want to thank our sponsors the Queer Cultural Center, San Francisco Arts Commission and Intersection for the Arts.

And a big thanks to YOU!

story:
A Story of Redemption 

Using a cast of three to play 40 distinct characters, this bold, intelligent work stems from the idea that a german Chancellor might, as an act of redemption, invite six million Jews to Germany and promise them citizenship and jobs. This play follows the varying outlooks of Jews and Gentiles through the lens of a Jewish dock worker moving both his son and Irish wife to Bremerhaven in hopes of a new life, a survivor of Auschwitz returning to find the woman who betrayed his family to the Nazis, a young German smitten by a Jewish American teenager, an unemployed German laborer, and scores of others.  This script challenges the actors to fully transform in order to enhance the logical progression of this artfully drawn script, which raises the terrifying possibility that history may repeat itself. 

Produced by Kelsey Griswold in association with unMasqued  (www.unmasqued.org), LEBENSRAUM will be directed by Josh Henry and play at the Complete Actors Place in Los Angeles, California. July 17, 18, 19 & 24, 25, 26. 

From Kelsey Griswold: 

Recently, there has been a rise of anti-semitism throughout Europe including major acts of violence not to mention misunderstanding, miscommunication, and a total lack of compassion. This play is a direct reflection of the importance in addressing this issue now, head on.  We cannot undo the past, but we can work together to ensure these horrific acts are never repeated.

Why We Need YOU

We need your help in funding so that this amazing story can be told.  We have believed since day one that this is a communal effort and so we invite you to join us in what we feel is a meaningful and worthy endeavor. 

All proceeds from Indiegogo will go directly to production in the following ways:

Rent for Space: We want to give this play the space it deserves. CAP is the ideal performance venue complete with full lights, sound, technicians, and a supportive operations team... but it's wicked expensive. 

Feed An Artist: You know what we mean. There are actors, directors, and designers who do this for a living and need to eat to make their best work possible. 

Rights: All artists deserve to be compensated and the playwright is no exception. Israel Horovitz needs to eat, too. 

Publicity: We want to fill the houses and share our story with as many LA-based community members as possible! This means posters, postcards, a sponsored Facebook page, etc. 


Oh, did we mention....

ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE!!! 


But, even if you can't contribute financially we would love your help:

  • Spread word about our campaign! 
  • Bring your friends and families to see the production. 
  • Don't forget to use the 'Share' tools for Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.

story:
This Indiegogo campaign is to fund the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble's 16th Spring Season of performances in New York City and Houston.

The Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble is a contemporary dance ensemble that specializes in commissioning new music for dance and incorporating musicians into the visual stage imagery. Sharing the stage and the focus, our dancers and musicians break the boundaries of traditional ensemble interaction. Performance works include original choreography and music as well as improvisation by all performers, creating a spontaneous performance environment where anything can happen. The Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble is known for innovative format, bold subject matter, and wide range of music spanning from classical to jazz to avant-garde and experimental. 

Spring 2015 Season of Performances:

Our Spring 2015 Season includes performances on Friday May 1 at 8 p.m. at the ShapeShifter Lab in New York City, and Thurs, Friday and Saturday June 25, 26 & 27 at 8 p.m. at Studio 101 Theatre in Houston.

Our performance at the ShapeShifter Lab will include the New York premiere of "No Standing Any Time" with choreography by Michele Brangwen and music by Grammy-nominated trumpeter and composer Tim Hagans, with sections of movement and music created spontaneously in the moment by all performers.  The program will also include "Invitation," called "sensuous and poetic" by ARTSHOUSTON Magazine, with choreography by Michele Brangwen and music by Seth Paynter. Soprano saxophone combines with gong, woodbock, snaps and Burma bells to create a mystical performance environment.

Our performances at Studio 101 will include the Houston premiere of "Rain Girl," along with new works and special guest artists. It will be an exciting program in a new theatre for us.

Performers for our Spring 2015 Season include Roberta Cortes, Robin Gilbert, Michele Brangwen, Tim Hagans, Seth Paynter, Thomas Helton, and Joe Hertenstein, with special guest artists to be announced. 

More About the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble:

In November 2014 we launched Season 2 of ARTCAST, our Internet Television Series that features new dance, music and film created in Houston, New York, Los Angeles and Vancouver. Season 2 consisted of 8 episodes, a new one broadcast each week at the same time. You can watch Season 1 & 2 any time on our website or youtube channel.

Here is a link to Episode 1 of ARTCAST Season 2 that features a new work from choreographer Michele Brangwen and composer Tim Hagans. "In And Out of the Shadows" was inspired by John Cassavetes ground-breaking film "Shadows."

You can also watch a film of "No Standing Any Time" that aired as part of ARTCAST Season 1.


In 2014, the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble was presented by the Festival of New Trumpet Music at the Village Zendo in New York City. In June 2013 the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble premiered Season 1 of ARTCAST that featured dance, music and film created in Houston & New York. In January 2012, the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble performed as part of Dance Theatre of Harlem’s Sunday Matineé Concert Series. Notable commissions include a new site-specific work for FotoFest International’s Biennial in April 2012. In December 2008 the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble traveled to Sweden to create a dance and music on camera project with the Norrbotten Big Band, an internationally acclaimed jazz ensemble based in Luleå. The Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble returned to Sweden in December 2009 for live performances with the Norrbotten Big Band at the Stora Salen Theater in Luleå and the Akusticum Theater in Piteå.

The Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble has been featured at the Hobby Center for the Performing Arts in Houston, Texas as part of FotoFest’s 2006 International Biennial dedicated to the themes of The Earth and Artists Responding to Violence. We have been presented at Northwestern University by the International Society of Improvised Music; the Interart Annex in New York City by Creative Women New York, and three times at the Miller Outdoor Theater as part of the Annual Weekend of Texas Contemporary Dance.

Now entering our sixteenth season of performances, the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble has commissioned twenty-one new music works for dance. Composers include Tim Hagans, Seth Paynter, Thomas Helton, Brian Nelson, Carol Morgan, Reynaldo Ochoa, Arthur Gottschalk.

story:
Summary

Sex worker, podcaster and journalist Siouxsie Q makes her New York City debut bringing her original one act musical to the Brick Theater this summer!  Siouxsie Q has made quite a splash since launching her Sex Work themed Podcast "The WhoreCast" in the Fall of 2012 with the mission to humanize people in the sex industry by creating a platform for sex workers to share their art, their stories - their voices. “Through art and storytelling I hope that we can change hearts and minds and show the world that sex workers are people too…though sometimes we are also mermaids.” says Q.  Capitalizing on the success of the Whorecast, Siouxsie has become a prolific writer as a regular columnist for the SF weekly and a featured writer for Ratter.com, Eros Media, and the Slixa blog.  

Fish-girl is the culmination of 5 years of long distance collaboration between Miss Q and her best friend, award winning theatre maker Sean Andries out of Portland, Oregon. A fairy tale exploring themes of sex work through the lens of fantasy, Fish-girl weaves together the tale of a love struck tourist (Sean Andries) who falls into the deep end when he meets the "girl" of his dreams (Siouxsie Q).  She’s half fish, half girl, half real, half dream, half in this world, half out--a fish and a bird can fall in love, but where can they build their nest?

Fish-girl includes original songs written and performed by Siouxsie Q as well as  shadow play, physical comedy, antique slide projections and high drama. But perhaps the most exciting aspect of the play is that it is an insider’s look into the hopes, dreams, and fears of a sex worker and the one who loves her. 


WHEN: Wednesday, June 24 to Sunday, June 28:

·  Wednesday, June 24 at 7:00pm

·  Thursday, June 25 at 9:00pm

·  Saturday, June 27, at 7:00pm

·  Sunday, June 28 at 4:00pm

WHERE:  The Brick Theater

579 Metropolitan Ave.

Brooklyn, NY 11211

TICKETS:

Tickets are $18 and can be purchased in advance at www.bricktheater.com. https://m.ovationtix.com/pr/946956


Please help this show continue to find new audiences. Please give now!

What We Need

We need 5500 dollars to get Fish Girl to NYC.  Your money goes to:

  • Food/Lodging for Siouxsie Q, Sean Andries and our crew of 3 for the 10 days that we will be in New York putting on the show
  • Airfare from Oakland CA & Portland OR to New York
  • Set construction - it's cheaper to rebuild than ship
  • Marketing so we can fill the house 
  • F!ck Fest application and festival fees 
  • Indie a go go fees

The Impact

We will not be able to do this show and spread its message without your support.  Not only is this an amazing play but it is an important one.  We truly believe that we can change people's hearts and minds through storytelling and art.  Fish-girl is one of those stories.  

Read these articles about the show if you are not convinced:

Navigating the Waters: Podcaster, Sex Worker, Fish-Tailed Ukelelian, Siouxsie Q is Putting it All Out There

Fringe Fest review: '52 Letters,' 'Fish Girl' excel 


"On the cutting edge of fantasy." -      BroadwayWorld.com 


Risks & Challenges

Putting on a show is always a challenge, let alone putting on a show in a city as big as New York.  We are lucky to be a part of a great festival - "F!ckfest" - at a great theatre - The Brick Theatre - yet obstacles and challenges still lie ahead.  From finding a wine barrel and building a set in a strange town to getting people to come to the show to feeding our crew, this will be a grand adventure, and we need YOUR HELP to make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can dig deep in their pockets to help us out, but thankfully there are loads of other ways to help us out!

You can:

  • Help us raise money by spreading the word online
  • Help us find our audience by telling your friends about the show
  • Help us keep our sanity by encouraging us along the way

story:
Theatricals

Theatricals is a brand new performance company for adults with learning disabilities and additional needs in Basingstoke. The aim of theatricals is to use the increased confidence through performing on stage to raise the ceiling of expectation, giving participants the chance to achieve their social, personal and theatrical potential by performing to their peers and the general public. 

Theatricals is a partnership between Fluid Motion Theatre Company and Mencap Basingstoke. The group started in June 2015 and will meet every week at The Ridgeway Centre in Buckskin. Participants learn a range of different skills and techniques, including mime, clowning, improvisation, prop making and lots more. 

Our Vision

Our vision is to create a highly professional performance company over a period of three years, with a view to maintaining the group long after it has been established. We believe that the process of creating public performances can empower people, giving them the confidence to achieve and feel valued by society. Our aim to develop high quality shows that will be performed locally and regionally enhances the opportunity for us to break down the ‘us and them’ stigmatisation that can present itself between community groups. 
Your donation, however large, will go towards the vital core runnings costs of Theatricals, ensuring the group keeps running week after week. Your donation will also give the group immense pride and satisfaction, showing them that the general public are hugely supportive of what they are doing and the performances they are creating.

Why Drama?

Drama is a fantastic way of building confidence, self esteem and gives adults with learning disabilities the chance to explore their imagination in a safe and nuturing environment. 

As Drama isn't overly reliant on cognitive ability it addresses the needs of participants at different levels. Through the use of touch, musical instruments and objects the group are able to gain a sensory experience. Drama is also highly interactive, playful and fun, giving participants a sense of mastery and achievement that they may not get elsewhere. 

Drama can also help enhance employability skills. Drama-based methods are more personal and practical, less reliant on literacy and verbal expression, and help address thoughts, feelings and behaviours.

What We Need

Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council are part funding this project. We are looking to raise an additional £800. This will ensure the project is fully funded for this year and participants will continue have the opportunity to attend the weekly session they have thoroughly enjoyed so far. 

What You Get

The group would like to offer all of the contributors a unique, personalised thank you. They have come up with the following:

£5 - Personalised thank you letter from the Theatricals.

£10 - Personalised thank you letter plus one of our handmade 'spoon puppets' made by the Theatricals production group. 

£20 - All of the above plus a free ticket to a show.

£50 - All of the above plus a free ticket to two shows. 

£100+ - All of the above plus a personalised thank you video from the Theatricals.• 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that not everyone will be able to make a financial contribution. This is absolute fine, there are other ways you can help:

•  Spread the word about our campaign and use our social media pages:

1  Facebook: www.facebook.com/fluidmotiontc 

2  Twitter: @fluidmotiontc @bstokemencap

3  Fluid Motion Website: www.fluidmotiontheatre.co.uk 

4  Basingstoke Mencap Website: http://www.basingstokemencap.btck.co.uk 

•  Use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Theatricals thank you for your support.
